Title: Analyst, Data & Analytics
Description:
Job Description

Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International?

Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It With Pride.

Together with analytics team leaders you will support our business with excellent data models to uncover trends that can drive long-term business results.

How You Will Contribute

You will:


Work in close partnership with the business leadership team to execute the analytics agenda
Identify and incubate best-in-class external partners to drive delivery on strategic projects
Develop custom models/algorithms to uncover signals/patterns and trends to drive long-term business performance
Execute the business analytics program agenda using a methodical approach that conveys to stakeholders what business analytics will deliver



What You Will Bring

A desire to drive your future and accelerate your career and the following experience and knowledge:


Using data analysis to make recommendations to senior leaders
Technical experience in roles in best-in-class analytics practices
Experience deploying new analytical approaches in a complex and highly matrixed organization
Savvy in usage of the analytics techniques to create business impacts



Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International?

In this role, you will have the opportunity to lead the development of a cutting-edge solution that aims to automate data pipelines, reporting and insights to standardize business performance across the organization. You will play an instrumental part in shaping and prioritizing the features of this solution in daily operations. You will define the requirements, perform the analysis and identify patterns in large amounts of data.

Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It With Pride.

How you will contribute:


Define requirements for analysis in Sales functional area and perform detailed analysis and identify trends defined in the requirements, in Customer and Category Analytics, Operational Sales Analytics, Retail Analytics and Execution, RGM, TPM, and other solutions.
Work as a single point of contact within D&A domain for Business and IT Stakeholders to identify and prioritize requirements and drive adoption of D&A products.
Identify patterns and help the business react to changing business conditions
Lead the team to perform root-cause analysis and interpret data.
Work with large amounts of data such as facts, figures, and mathematics/formulas and undertake analytical activities, and delivers analysis outputs in accordance with customer needs and conforming to established standards.
Understand and be involved with aspects of the data exploration and analysis process.
As an investigator on the data & analytics team, you will apply your knowledge of languages and pull data out of SQL databases, using Tableau/Power BI type tools and producing data visualizations and reporting dashboards.
Develop key performance indicators and create visualizations of the data
Utilize business intelligence and analytic tools
Execute business analytics agenda using a methodical approach
Deliver analytical projects



What You Will Bring

A desire to drive your future and accelerate your career and the following experience and knowledge:


5+ years of work experience in Data Analytics or Data Science required
Power BI, Tableau, and GCP (Google Cloud Platform) experience preferred
Knowledge of KPIs and scorecards required
Leader mindset – ability to make decisions and take accountability.
Experience in Product Management – contributing to Product Vision and Roadmap with the focus on consumers, partnering with Stakeholders, ensuring adoption and cost-efficiency.
Passion for building high-quality data products, using data to drive business growth and be comfortable working with data in an entrepreneurial, fast-paced setting.
Experience in Commercial Business domain, ideally in CPG or FMCG industry.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills to facilitate effective teamwork and stakeholder engagement, explaining complex data concepts to non-technical individuals.



What extra ingredients you will bring:


Understanding industry-specific external data sources used to measure and track performance (e.g., Nielsen).
Understanding of the consumer goods industry or similar industries.
Experience with data governance, privacy regulations, and best practices is a plus.
Experience working with Jira or ADO is a plus



Education / Certifications:


Bachelor's degree in Information Systems/Technology, Business Analytics, or a related field



More About This Role

Work Modality: Hybrid

Travel: The incumbent will be required to work from our Toronto, ON offices 3 days a week and from home 2 days a week.

No Relocation support available

Business Unit Summary

With several brands that are among consumer favourites, including Cadbury, OREO, Christie and Maynards, we are one of the largest snack companies in Canada. Many of our iconic brands are ranked first, second or third in their categories, and our manufacturers and pastry chefs have an enviable mission to create and manufacture chocolate, cookies, crackers and candy in our iconic factories and locations across Ontario. A company with many ambitious growth targets, we have invested close to $250 million in our Ontario plants in recent years alone; We run marketing campaigns promoting innovative products such as Cadbury Dark Milk tablets and OREO Birthday Cake and Peppermint Bark cookies. Our community of more than 2,683 employees is present across Canada and our head office is in Toronto. Passion and dedication characterize our Company. We encourage all our employees to be themselves at work, to speak out and to encourage diversity in all areas of activity. In addition, we foster a flexible work environment and place great importance on the notions of trust and empathy to promote a true sense of belonging.

Mondelez welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates with disabilities taking part in all aspects of the selection process. Please note that the term "accommodation" in this posting means changes that are made in order to meet the needs of a person with disabilities and not lodging.

Job Type

Regular

Analytics & Modelling

Analytics & Data Science
Show more
HTML:
Job Description

Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International?

Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It With Pride.

Together with analytics team leaders you will support our business with excellent data models to uncover trends that can drive long-term business results.

How You Will Contribute

You will:

  • Work in close partnership with the business leadership team to execute the analytics agenda
  • Identify and incubate best-in-class external partners to drive delivery on strategic projects
  • Develop custom models/algorithms to uncover signals/patterns and trends to drive long-term business performance
  • Execute the business analytics program agenda using a methodical approach that conveys to stakeholders what business analytics will deliver


What You Will Bring

A desire to drive your future and accelerate your career and the following experience and knowledge:

  • Using data analysis to make recommendations to senior leaders
  • Technical experience in roles in best-in-class analytics practices
  • Experience deploying new analytical approaches in a complex and highly matrixed organization
  • Savvy in usage of the analytics techniques to create business impacts


Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International?

In this role, you will have the opportunity to lead the development of a cutting-edge solution that aims to automate data pipelines, reporting and insights to standardize business performance across the organization. You will play an instrumental part in shaping and prioritizing the features of this solution in daily operations. You will define the requirements, perform the analysis and identify patterns in large amounts of data.

Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It With Pride.

How you will contribute:

  • Define requirements for analysis in Sales functional area and perform detailed analysis and identify trends defined in the requirements, in Customer and Category Analytics, Operational Sales Analytics, Retail Analytics and Execution, RGM, TPM, and other solutions.
  • Work as a single point of contact within D&A domain for Business and IT Stakeholders to identify and prioritize requirements and drive adoption of D&A products.
  • Identify patterns and help the business react to changing business conditions
  • Lead the team to perform root-cause analysis and interpret data.
  • Work with large amounts of data such as facts, figures, and mathematics/formulas and undertake analytical activities, and delivers analysis outputs in accordance with customer needs and conforming to established standards.
  • Understand and be involved with aspects of the data exploration and analysis process.
  • As an investigator on the data & analytics team, you will apply your knowledge of languages and pull data out of SQL databases, using Tableau/Power BI type tools and producing data visualizations and reporting dashboards.
  • Develop key performance indicators and create visualizations of the data
  • Utilize business intelligence and analytic tools
  • Execute business analytics agenda using a methodical approach
  • Deliver analytical projects


What You Will Bring

A desire to drive your future and accelerate your career and the following experience and knowledge:

  • 5+ years of work experience in Data Analytics or Data Science required
  • Power BI, Tableau, and GCP (Google Cloud Platform) experience preferred
  • Knowledge of KPIs and scorecards required
  • Leader mindset – ability to make decisions and take accountability.
  • Experience in Product Management – contributing to Product Vision and Roadmap with the focus on consumers, partnering with Stakeholders, ensuring adoption and cost-efficiency.
  • Passion for building high-quality data products, using data to drive business growth and be comfortable working with data in an entrepreneurial, fast-paced setting.
  • Experience in Commercial Business domain, ideally in CPG or FMCG industry.
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills to facilitate effective teamwork and stakeholder engagement, explaining complex data concepts to non-technical individuals.


What extra ingredients you will bring:

  • Understanding industry-specific external data sources used to measure and track performance (e.g., Nielsen).
  • Understanding of the consumer goods industry or similar industries.
  • Experience with data governance, privacy regulations, and best practices is a plus.
  • Experience working with Jira or ADO is a plus


Education / Certifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Information Systems/Technology, Business Analytics, or a related field


More About This Role

Work Modality: Hybrid

Travel: The incumbent will be required to work from our Toronto, ON offices 3 days a week and from home 2 days a week.

No Relocation support available

Business Unit Summary

With several brands that are among consumer favourites, including Cadbury, OREO, Christie and Maynards, we are one of the largest snack companies in Canada. Many of our iconic brands are ranked first, second or third in their categories, and our manufacturers and pastry chefs have an enviable mission to create and manufacture chocolate, cookies, crackers and candy in our iconic factories and locations across Ontario. A company with many ambitious growth targets, we have invested close to $250 million in our Ontario plants in recent years alone; We run marketing campaigns promoting innovative products such as Cadbury Dark Milk tablets and OREO Birthday Cake and Peppermint Bark cookies. Our community of more than 2,683 employees is present across Canada and our head office is in Toronto. Passion and dedication characterize our Company. We encourage all our employees to be themselves at work, to speak out and to encourage diversity in all areas of activity. In addition, we foster a flexible work environment and place great importance on the notions of trust and empathy to promote a true sense of belonging.

Mondelez welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates with disabilities taking part in all aspects of the selection process. Please note that the term "accommodation" in this posting means changes that are made in order to meet the needs of a person with disabilities and not lodging.

Job Type

Regular

Analytics & Modelling

Analytics & Data Science

Title: Analista de datos
Description:
Únete a nuestro equipo y contribuye en mejorar el futuro de las personas

#AllianzMexico #LetsCareForTomorrow #TeamAllianz




Solicitamos: ANALISTA DE DATOS




Acerca de la empresa:

El Grupo Allianz es una multinacional alemana de servicios financieros con sede en Múnich. Es uno de los grupos aseguradores y proveedores de servicios financieros más importantes del mundo.




Principales responsabilidades del puesto:

Desarrollar y analizar cifras y KPIs de acuerdo con las necesidades de la línea de negocio para generar estrategias de crecimiento rentable.
Construcción de información histórica de todos los ramos mediante consultas en R y VBA.
Elaboración de tableros y dashboards.




Requisitos para el puesto:

Lic. en Económico-administrativa, Finanzas, Actuaría o afín (concluida)
Experiencia mínima de 3 años en generación de Dashboards en Power BI.
Programación en R
Experiencia en seguros de Daños
Manejo de R, Power BI, VBA, Office
Inglés nivel intermedio




Prestaciones y beneficios adicionales:

Sueldo base competitivo
Bono anual por resultados
Vacaciones superiores a las de la ley
Fondo de ahorro y caja de ahorro
Seguro de Gastos Médicos Mayores
Seguro de Vida
Vales de despensa y restaurante
Buen ambiente laboral
Horario flexible e híbrido con 2 días de HO a la semana, entre otros.




En Allianz el bienestar de nuestros colaboradores es muy importante por lo que no solo ofrecemos herramientas que los apoyan en su desarrollo profesional y personal.




Plataforma Degreed (cursos en línea) abierta para todos los colaboradores
Aplicación MiDocOnline a través de la cual los colaboradores pueden consultar médicos generales, psicólogos y nutriólogos de manera gratuita
Diferentes eventos deportivos y de integración.




Interesados postularse por este medio.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About The Team

Turo is seeking a Data Analyst to join our growing team and turbo-charge Turo’s growth in the US. This Data Analyst will have the opportunity to work within the Risk and Protection domain and collaborate with Product, Engineering, Operations, and Trust and Safety teams. The ideal person for this role possesses strong quantitative and analytics skills, is a demonstrated self-starter that operates with an ownership mindset, possess excellent communication skills, and has the ability to get up to speed quickly on different topics and areas.

Responsibilities


Analyze complex data sets to identify areas of opportunities, formulate actionable recommendations, and test these insights
Present analysis and recommendations to Exec leadership and work with product teams to rapidly execute and iterate based on feedback
Lead experimentation from designing tests to analyzing results that lead to product launch decisions
Partner with product, data science, and operations leadership to influence the direction of the product with the goal of improving user experience and/or profitability of the business
Support ad-hoc analytical projects based on Turo strategic priorities
Establish data specifications, build ETL pipelines, and assess the impact of new product releases and policy changes on the platform\


Requirements


2+ years experience in product/data analytics, data science, business intelligence, or strategy consulting; experience in consumer tech, marketplaces or e-commerce a strong plus
Top notch quantitative skills; strong proficiency in conducting detailed data analysis and using metrics to drive business results
Strong SQL skills and understanding of relational databases; experience with BI & visualization tools is a strong plus (i.e. DOMO, Tableau)
Experience transforming data into presentations that “tell the story” behind the data
Comfortable working with MS Excel and MS PowerPoint
Must be intellectually curious, self-motivated, detail-oriented, and able to multitask
Must have strong communication skills and have the ability to articulate complex insights
Thrive working in a collaborative environment and have experience working cross-functionally


Bonus if you have


Experience designing and executing AB tests is a strong plus


For this role, the target base salary range for remote locations in the US is $125,000 - $140,000 annually, and your recruiter can share more about the specific range for your location. This role is also eligible for equity and benefits. In general, our ranges reflect the minimum and maximum market-based targets for the role based on its level and location and are subject to change. Within the range, individual pay is determined by objective factors assessed during the application and interview process, such as job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. We encourage you to talk with your recruiter to learn more about the total compensation and benefits available for this role.

Benefits


Competitive salary, equity, benefits, and perks for all full-time employees
Employer-paid medical, dental, and vision insurance (Country specific)
Retirement employer match
Learning & Development stipend to invest in your professional development
Turo host matching program
Turo travel credit
Cell phone and internet stipend
Paid time off to relax and recharge
Paid holidays, volunteer time off, and parental leave
For those who are in the office full-time or hybrid we have in-office lunch, office snacks, and fun activities


We are committed to building a diverse team. If you are from a background that's underrepresented in tech, we'd love to meet you.

Aside from an award winning work environment and the opportunity to be part of the world’s largest car sharing marketplace, we are also growing the team quickly - join us! Even if you don't meet every qualification, we are looking for people with enthusiasm for what we do and we will consider you for this and other possibilities.

About Turo

Turo is the world’s largest car sharing marketplace where you can book the perfect car for wherever you’re going from a vibrant community of trusted hosts across the US, UK, Canada, Australia, and France. Whether you're flying in from afar or looking for a car down the street, searching for a rugged truck or something smooth and swanky, Turo puts you in the driver's seat of an extraordinary selection of cars shared by local hosts.

Discover Turo at https://turo.com, the App Store, and Google Play, and check out our blog, Field Notes.

Read more about the Turo culture according to Turo CEO, Andre Haddad.

Turo is an Equal Opportunity Employer and a participant in the U.S. Federal E-Verify program. Women, minorities, individuals with disabilities and protected veterans are encouraged to apply. We welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives.

Turo will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, as applicable.

We welcome candidates with physical, mental, and/or neurological disabilities. If you require assistance applying for an open position, or need accommodation during the recruiting process due to a disability, please submit a request to People Operations by emailing PeopleOps@turo.com.

Title: L/S Data Analyst
Description:
A Career with Point72’s Long/Short Equities Team

Long/short equity is Point72’s largest investment strategy, and our success is dependent upon our investing teams, comprised of portfolio managers and research analysts.

What You’ll Do

As a data analyst embedded in an investing team, you will help drive innovation by leveraging a variety of data sources and systems. You will work directly with a portfolio manager and their team of research analysts to connect data and fundamental research. Your work will support investment theses and help inform investment decisions.


Work directly with a portfolio manager and a team of research analysts to analyze a broad universe of Compliance-approved data to directly influence idea generation and investment decisions, with an emphasis on equities.
Design, build, and maintain data products and predictive models that enable analysis of key performance indicators (KPIs) and forward-looking metrics relevant to your specific sector.
Investigate and explore innovative approaches to extract meaningful information from complex datasets.
Develop agile, automated systems that rapidly ingest, synthesize, and analyze diverse sets of information in real-time, producing actionable insights to support timely decision-making.
Optimize and scale existing data infrastructure to enhance performance, reliability, and adaptability in handling complex, high-volume data streams.
Develop and maintain high-quality, efficient, and modular code, creating well-documented custom libraries and data pipelines that enhance the team's analytical capabilities and ensure reproducibility of results.
Stay on top of the newest technologies approved for use across the firm.
Partner with Compliance on all aspects such as approved data sources, permissibility of systems, and analytics.


What’s Required


Undergraduate degree or higher.
Quantitative ability as demonstrated through relevant coursework or work equivalent.
Experience working with diverse data types including structured, unstructured (e.g., text), and time-series data.
Strong understanding of statistical concepts and their application to large-scale data analysis, with an interest in applying these skills to financial datasets.
Strong coding skills in a high-level programming language (e.g., SQL, Python, R, or similar). Familiarity with version control systems (such as Git) and collaborative development practices. Ability to comprehend, navigate, and expand existing code bases.
Strong data visualization skills, with experience in creating informative visualizations using coding languages like Python or R.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to approach complex issues systematically and creatively. Demonstrated capacity to translate business questions into data-driven solutions.
Demonstrated interest in AI applications and experience using widely available AI tools and platform.
Team player with an entrepreneurial spirit and good communication skills.
Deep intellectual curiosity and lifelong-learning mindset.
Commitment to the highest ethical standards.


We Take Care of Our People

We invest in our people, their careers, their health, and their well-being. When you work here, we provide:


Fully-paid health care benefits
Generous parental and family leave policies
Mental and physical wellness programs
Volunteer opportunities
Non-profit matching gift program
Support for employee-led affinity groups representing women, minorities and the LGBTQ+ community
Tuition assistance
A 401(k) savings program with an employer match and more


About Point72

Point72 is a leading global alternative investment firm led by Steven A. Cohen. Building on more than 30 years of investing experience, Point72 seeks to deliver superior returns for its investors through fundamental and systematic investing strategies across asset classes and geographies. We aim to attract and retain the industry’s brightest talent by cultivating an investor-led culture and committing to our people’s long-term growth. For more information, visit www.Point72.com/about.

The annual base salary range for this role is $150,000-$180,000 (USD) , which does not include discretionary bonus compensation or our comprehensive benefits package. Actual compensation offered to the successful candidate may vary from posted hiring range based upon geographic location, work experience, education, and/or skill level, among other things.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Data Analyst

Introduction: Join our client's dynamic team as a Data Analyst, where you will play a pivotal role in driving our business decisions through expert data analysis and reporting. Your proficiency in SQL, experience with Excel and PowerPoint, and ability to utilize data visualization tools will be key to your success in this role.

Key Responsibilities


Develop and execute complex SQL queries for ad hoc data analysis, helping our team to make informed decisions quickly.
Utilize Excel to extract data, create effective visualizations, and leverage PowerPoint to present these insights compellingly.
Work with data visualization tools such as MicroStrategy, Tableau, or PowerBI to understand and use MS reports efficiently. Gather and document requirements for new dashboards or enhancements to existing ones.
Collaborate cross-functionally with data engineers, product managers, business analysts, and business users to ensure cohesive communication and effective project outcomes.
Apply critical thinking to analyze datasets, ask pertinent questions, identify data discrepancies, and uncover insights that drive business strategy.
Maintain a high standard of data quality, ensuring that all reports provide accurate and reliable insights.


Qualifications


Proficiency in SQL with a strong understanding of writing and analyzing queries.
Experienced in using Excel for data manipulation and creating charts, along with proficiency in PowerPoint for storytelling through data.
Experience in data visualization and reporting with tools like MicroStrategy, Tableau, or PowerBI. Familiarity with MicroStrategy is a plus.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to work effectively across multiple teams.
Strong analytical skills with a keen eye for data quality and accuracy.

Title: Compliance Data Analyst (Excel, Power BI)
Description:
Compliance Data Analyst

We have an immediate need for a Compliance Data Analyst to join a casino/hospitality company for a 6-month contract that’s remote capable. The Compliance Analyst will support the compliance team by reviewing, analyzing, and verifying data for accuracy to resolve discrepancies and ensure compliance with data access policies.




Location: Remote (Pacific Time business hours)

This job expects to pay about $30-36/hr per hour plus benefits.




What You Will Do:

Review and validate compliance-related data in Excel and Power BI for accuracy and consistency.
Compare vendor-provided data against internal records, identifying and resolving discrepancies.
Collaborate with vendors and internal teams to ensure data integrity and compliance.
Analyze and refine data without building or extracting new datasets.
Investigate and escalate data access issues as needed.
Maintain thorough documentation of compliance reviews and resolutions.
Support compliance initiatives by following established protocols and best practices.

What Gets You The Job:

2-3 years of experience in compliance, data analysis, or related roles.
Strong proficiency in Excel for data review and manipulation.
Experience with Power BI.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills to collaborate with vendors and internal teams.
High attention to detail with the ability to identify inconsistencies and ensure accuracy.
Ability to work independently and follow structured compliance processes.
Experience handling sensitive data with discretion and confidentiality.







Please send your resume to Hannah Xu, Senior Technical Recruiter for immediate consideration.




Irvine Technology Corporation (ITC) is a leading provider of technology and staffing solutions for IT, Security, Engineering, and Interactive Design disciplines servicing startups to enterprise clients, nationally. We pride ourselves in the ability to introduce you to our intimate network of business and technology leaders – bringing you opportunity coupled with personal growth, and professional development! Join us. Let us catapult your career!




Irvine Technology Corporation provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Irvine Technology Corporation complies with applicable state and local laws governing non-discrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities.

This job expects to pay about $30-36/hr per hour plus benefits.


What You Will Do:

  • Review and validate compliance-related data in Excel and Power BI for accuracy and consistency.
  • Compare vendor-provided data against internal records, identifying and resolving discrepancies.
  • Collaborate with vendors and internal teams to ensure data integrity and compliance.
  • Analyze and refine data without building or extracting new datasets.
  • Investigate and escalate data access issues as needed.
  • Maintain thorough documentation of compliance reviews and resolutions.
  • Support compliance initiatives by following established protocols and best practices.

What Gets You The Job:

  • 2-3 years of experience in compliance, data analysis, or related roles.
  • Strong proficiency in Excel for data review and manipulation.
  • Experience with Power BI.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills to collaborate with vendors and internal teams.
  • High attention to detail with the ability to identify inconsistencies and ensure accuracy.
  • Ability to work independently and follow structured compliance processes.
  • Experience handling sensitive data with discretion and confidentiality.



Please send your resume to Hannah Xu, Senior Technical Recruiter for immediate consideration.


Irvine Technology Corporation (ITC) is a leading provider of technology and staffing solutions for IT, Security, Engineering, and Interactive Design disciplines servicing startups to enterprise clients, nationally. We pride ourselves in the ability to introduce you to our intimate network of business and technology leaders – bringing you opportunity coupled with personal growth, and professional development! Join us. Let us catapult your career!


Irvine Technology Corporation provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Irvine Technology Corporation complies with applicable state and local laws governing non-discrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are HCLTech, one of the fastest-growing large tech companies in the world and home to 218,000 people across 60 countries, supercharging progress through industry-leading capabilities centered around Digital, Engineering and Cloud. (www.hcltech.com )




The driving force behind that work, our people, are diverse, creative, and passionate, raising the bar for excellence on a regular basis. We, in turn, work hard to bring out the best in them as we strive to help them find their spark and become the best version of themselves that they can be. If all this sounds like an environment you’ll thrive in, then you’re in the right place.




We are looking for a highly talented and self- motivated Data Analyst III to join us on our journey in advancing the technological world through innovation and creativity.










Job Title: Data Analyst III

Position Type: Full-time

Location: NYC,NY _Will consider Remote Workers




Summary:

The main function of a data analyst is to coordinate changes to computer databases, test, and implement the database applying knowledge of database management systems. A typical database analyst/programmer is responsible for planning, coordinating and implementing security measures to safeguard the computer database.




4+ years working in an Analytics team

4+ years experience delivering presentations to key stakeholders

4+ years professional experience with Excel (PivotTable, Charts, Statistical functions), advanced proficiency in SQL and Python




Job Responsibilities:

• Test programs or databases, correct errors and make necessary modifications.

• Modify existing databases and database management systems or direct programmers and analysts to make changes.

• Write and code logical and physical database descriptions and specify identifiers of database to management system or direct others in coding descriptions.

• Work as part of a project team to coordinate database development and determine project scope and limitations.

• Review project requests describing database user needs to estimate time and cost required to accomplish project.




Skills:

• Verbal and written communication skills, problem solving skills, customer service and interpersonal skills.

• Ability to work independently and manage one’s time.

• Basic mentoring skills necessary to provide support and constructive performance feedback.

• Knowledge of database management software.




Education/Experience:

• Bachelor's degree in math, statistics, or economics or equivalent experience but not necessary, experience is preferred over education







HCLTech is an equal opportunity employer, committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees regardless of race, religion, sex, color, age, national origin, pregnancy, sexual orientation, physical disability or genetic information, military or veteran status, or any other protected classification, in accordance with federal, state, and/or local law. Should any applicant have concerns about discrimination in the hiring process, they should provide a detailed report of those concerns to secure@hcltech.com for investigation.

A candidate’s pay within the range will depend on their skills, experience, education, and other factors permitted by law. This role may also be eligible for performance-based bonuses subject to company policies. In addition, this role is eligible for the following benefits subject to company policies: medical, dental, vision, pharmacy, life, accidental death & dismemberment, and disability insurance; employee assistance program; 401(k) retirement plan; 10 days of paid time off per year (some positions are eligible for need-based leave with no designated number of leave days per year); and 10 paid holidays per year

How You’ll Grow




At HCLTech, we offer continuous opportunities for you to find your spark and grow with us. We want you to be happy and satisfied with your role and to really learn what type of work sparks your brilliance the best. Throughout your time with us, we offer transparent communication with senior-level employees, learning and career development programs at every level, and opportunities to experiment in different roles or even pivot industries. We believe that you should be in control of your career with unlimited opportunities to find the role that fits you best.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Aimé Leon Dore is looking for a Data Analyst to join our team in New York, New York, reporting directly to the Senior Data Analyst. Our data analysts play a critical role in this mission by collecting, cleaning, and analyzing data to provide actionable insights that drive better organizational decision-making. We seek a highly data-driven, detail-oriented analyst with experience working with raw data to produce actionable insights, assisting in the execution of weekly and monthly reporting, maintaining databases, and assisting in ad hoc analyses. A successful candidate will collaborate cross-functionally to support and optimize launches, merchandising standards, release roll-outs, segmentation, pricing strategies, and other initiatives. 

 

Duties and Responsibilities:

Collect data from multiple sources using appropriate queries and APIs, including Shopify, Klaviyo, and Metabase.
Build strong working relationships with cross-functional partners to understand trends and opportunities for improvement, address customer needs, & identify pain points.
Collaborate with Marketing to support and optimize launches, merchandising standards, & special projects. 
Clean and transform raw data to ensure accuracy and consistency for analysis.
Perform data analysis using SQL, specifically Amazon Redshift SQL, to identify trends, patterns, and insights.
Create clear and concise data visualizations using Excel and Looker Studio to communicate findings to stakeholders.
Support the development and maintenance of data pipelines and automation processes.
Assist the senior analyst with more complex data analysis projects.
Partner cross-functionally with Digital Design and Product Management to understand how site updates (New site features, existing improvements, UX enhancements, etc.) impact business goals and onsite behavior. Use insights to make recommendations on changes in strategy.
Stay up-to-date on industry best practices and emerging data analysis techniques.

 

Qualifications:

2+ years of experience in Analytics, Ecommerce, or Finance
Bachelor's degree in Business Analytics, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field (or equivalent work experience).
Strong working knowledge of SQL, particularly Amazon Redshift SQL.
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, including data manipulation, analysis, and visualization techniques.
Experience with data collection tools and APIs is a plus.
Previous eCommerce experience preferred
Familiarity with data visualization tools like Looker Studio, Tableau, or Power BI is preferred.
Excellent attention to detail and strong analytical skills.
Strong communication and collaboration skills.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced and collaborative environment.
Interest in fashion, particularly streetwear, is a plus.

Salary: $65,000 - $70,000

Created in 2014, Aimé Leon Dore is a lifestyle, sport and ready-to-wear brand based out of Queens, New York. With a strong focus on simple yet powerful design, we are driven to create timeless work by portraying an aesthetic that is uniquely our own

Title: Fundamental Analyst - Alternative Data Analyst
Description:
We are working with one of the world’s premier hedge funds, looking for an Alternaitve Data Analyst to joined their Fundamental Equity business. The firm has a centralised research function which feeds into their Equity Long/Short business.




The fund manages over $60bn and trades all asset classes across the capital structure. Historically, they are one of the best performing asset managers, globally.




The team provide qualitative and quantitative market research on stocks and companies globally, research leveraged into key investment decisions. The hire will undertake primary research across conferences, expert calls and channel checks and ;everage advanced data metrics to inform invesmtent decisions.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
GlobeStar Systems is a leader in integrated clinical communication. Our cornerstone product, Connexall®, is an award-winning Enterprise grade IoT platform, purpose built for the healthcare industry. Connexall® is a sophisticated and customizable end-to-end integration and communication platform that helps its customers improve clinical workflow, reduce alarm fatigue, and drive better patient and staff outcomes.




Job Title: Data Analyst

Type: Full-Time

Start Date: Immediate

Location: Toronto, Ontario




Job Summary

Reporting to the Data & Analytics Team Lead, the Data Analyst will be a key member of the Connexall Data and Analytics Team. This role involves interpreting data, analyzing results, and developing reports and visualizations to provide actionable insights for various business units. The ideal candidate will possess strong analytical, technical, critical thinking, and communication skills, and excel in collaborative environments, whether working with small or large teams. Chosen candidate will become part of a dynamic team where the insights directly impact business decisions. Connexall is an environment that values innovation, collaboration, and growth.




Primary Responsibilities

Understand and adhere to GlobeStar’s ISO-13485-2016 Quality Management System, as well as all relevant operating procedures and work instructions.
Work closely with engineers and scientists to plan and design Analytics solutions.
Partner with internal and external business units to collect and document analytic requirements.
Leverage data and model outputs provided by engineers to deliver meaningful insights to stakeholders.
Create dashboards and visualizations using tools like Tableau and Power BI, presenting results to non-technical stakeholders through clear, actionable reports.
Provide constructive feedback to engineers and scientists on missing or inaccurate data that impacts the quality of analyses and models.
Collaborate with data scientists to translate complex models into practical business insights.
Perform other duties as assigned.




Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, related field.
A master’s degree is a plus.
Minimum two years of experience in data analysis or a related role.
Proficiency in data analysis tools such as SQL and Excel.
Expertise in data visualization tools like Power BI and Tableau.
Familiarity with programming languages, including Python or R.
Knowledge of statistical and predictive modeling techniques.
Experience with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud is an asset.
Familiarity with big data tools like Hadoop or Spark is a plus.
Certifications such as Microsoft Certified: Data Analyst Associate are advantageous.
Understanding of database management systems and querying.
Strong analytical thinking and problem-solving abilities.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey technical information to non-technical audiences.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively within a team environment.
High attention to detail and exceptional organizational skills.
Other duties as required.




Benefits

Competitive annual salary
A rich benefits package, including medical, dental, life, and long-term disability insurance
Retirement savings plan with employer contributions
Professional development & training opportunities
Education Reimbursement Program
Flexible work arrangements (Hybrid)
Collaborative & inclusive work environment




This position does not support a Labour Market Impact Assessment, or any other form of immigration sponsorship.

Title: Junior Data Analyst (SQL)
Description:
We offer:




• Become a member of a dynamic team which support Wealth Managements strategic objectives through the use and exploitation of its data and analytical assets

• International/multinational environment: team in Budapest Office works closely with the New York office.

• Collaborative creative environment

• Contingent/Leased assignment working onsite at Morgan Stanley

• Contract via 3rd party agency




You will:




• Partner extensively with other teams and business partners within and outside the department (such as sales, marketing, product owners, data science and data visualization teams) to deliver business solutions and support decision making

• Liaise with Technology partners to understand the data source and suggest enhancements as needed

• Utilize proactive problem-solving and innovative thinking to address challenges

• Build, monitor and review data models and conduct analyses based on specific requirements

• Provide analytics and insight for various business initiatives and projects

• Prepare and deliver presentations to highlight important metrics and showcase achievements

• Create relevant documentation where needed

• Assist in the development of Tableau dashboards and data visualizations for reporting to senior management and business users including Financial Advisors




You have:




• 0-3 years data analytics experience

• Bachelor’s or higher degree in Business Management or Economics or IT or Data Science

• Tech skills: SQL/Python/R

• Strong analytical mindset

• Strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills

• Detail oriented and ability to handle, prioritize multiple tasks simultaneously

• Passion for providing help to navigate through complex decisions for clients

• Excellent stakeholder management and communication skills

• Great presentation skills




You might also have:




• Background in the Financial Services Industry, with an emphasis on wealth management

• Experience working with technology teams closely

• Experience in data modelling and visualization technologies, such as: Dataiku, Python, Tableau, PowerBI, QlikView




Team Profile:




The Analytics & Data (A&D) organization is a key growth area within Morgan Stanley’s Wealth Management Division, playing a critical role in the execution of the wider Wealth Management strategy. The use of analytics and data will be a key driver in accelerating growth across all client segments, enabling data-driven decision making and delivering the best client experience.




About us:




Morgan Stanley is a global financial services firm and a market leader in investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services.

At Morgan Stanley Budapest, we are shaping the future of our global business and contributing to our local community. Our team works across numerous areas, including Technology, Mathematical Modelling, Finance, Risk Management, Wealth Management, and Data & Analytics from our state-of-the-art offices near the Danube and our City Gate office in the heart of the City Centre.

Title: Data Analyst - AdTech
Description:
Job Title: Data Analyst - AdTech Targeting Platform:




€60K + 30% bonus + stocks




About Our Client:

We're partnering with a leading global company revolutionizing the digital advertising landscape. They offer a cutting-edge, privacy-first unified targeting platform that empowers marketers to reach their ideal audiences with unparalleled precision. Trusted by Fortune 500 companies and emerging brands alike, their solutions drive increased reach, boost efficiency, and maximize ROI. With a global presence spanning the US, EMEA and Nordics they foster a tight-knit, collaborative culture that values diversity, innovation, and a passion for making a real impact.




About the Role:

As a Data Analyst - Solutions, you will play a crucial role in the successful implementation, optimization, and support of our client's ad tech solutions for clients across EMEA, APAC, and NAM regions. This position requires a strong understanding of advertising technology, exceptional data analytics skills, and the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.




Day-to-Day Responsibilities:

Develop and optimize accurate, scalable taxonomies for Always-On offerings across markets, focusing on performance and reach.
Serve as the primary technical support contact for clients, including media agencies, trading desks, publishers, and advertisers. Build strong client relationships and provide training on the platform.
Collaborate with partners to maintain and enhance taxonomies. Optimize internal SaaS platforms and advise on external platforms like DSPs and SSPs.
Act as a liaison between Data and Marketing teams to promote best-in-class segments and support seasonal and Always-On targets.
Conduct market analysis and competitive assessments, ensuring CPM competitiveness and proposing new strategies.
Maintain technical stability, troubleshoot issues, and develop custom solutions for partners.
Ensure data discoverability, understand data interactions with partner algorithms, and recommend tailored solutions for campaign optimization.
Collaborate on reporting and analysis to drive global optimization and platform enhancements.




Preferred Experience:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Marketing, or a related field.
3-5 years of experience in Technical Account Management or Data Analysis, preferably in consulting and managing complex software solutions.
Strong technical background with expertise in ad-serving platforms, programmatic advertising, DMPs, and related technologies.
Experience or strong interest in the online marketing industry.
Excellent communication, negotiation, and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex technical concepts to non-technical audiences.
Team player with a hands-on mentality and a drive to learn.
Sales and relationship-building skills.
Affinity for complex technical processes and tools.
Experience in data-driven marketing or programmatic advertising is a plus.
Fluency in written and spoken English.




Our Client is an Equal Opportunity Employer:

They celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. They strive to empower connection with one another, reflect the communities they serve, and tackle meaningful projects that make a real impact.




Next Steps:

If you are a highly motivated and skilled Data Analyst with a passion for the digital advertising space, we encourage you to apply. This is an excellent opportunity to join a growing company at the forefront of innovation. Please apply here!

They celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. They strive to empower connection with one another, reflect the communities they serve, and tackle meaningful projects that make a real impact.


Next Steps:

If you are a highly motivated and skilled Data Analyst with a passion for the digital advertising space, we encourage you to apply. This is an excellent opportunity to join a growing company at the forefront of innovation. Please apply here!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Seleccionamos Consultor Power BI Jpara incorporar a nuestras oficinas de Vic.

Vilar Riba somos una organización de asesoramiento global en los ámbitos fiscal, legal, laboral, consultoría, auditoria y M&A. Contamos con un equipo de más de 175 profesionales especializados y con una trayectoria de más de 30 años de experiencia. También formamos parte de la red Geneva Group Internacional (GGI) la sexta firma mundial de servicios profesionales a empresas.




Principales funciones

-Participar en proyectos de definición e implantación de cuadros de mando para las distintas áreas de la empresa mediante la utilización de las herramientas Business Intelligence de Microsoft Power BI.

-Obtención de datos, análisis y procesamiento de los mismos.

-Analizar y definir estrategia e identificar nuevas oportunidades de negocio.

-Comunicación constante con cliente para la toma de requerimientos, validación y soporte en la utilización.







Requisitos

-Formación de ingeniería informática, ingeniería industrial, grado en tecnología y empresa o grado en química o ADE.

-3 años de experiencia en Proyectos de Business Intelligence.

-Experiencia en MS Power BI, lenguaje DAX, configuración de Data Gateway y funcionalidades de PowerQuery.

-Perfil analítico, dinámico y riguroso, acostumbrado a manejar y analizar indicadores de gestión de negocio.

Valorable buen nivel de inglés.




Ofrecemos

-Proyección profesional basada en la continua adquisición de conocimientos y experiencia participando en proyectos en organizaciones de primer nivel.

-Excelente ambiente de trabajo.

-Formar parte de un equipo joven, motivado y altamente especializado.

-Asumir responsabilidades con clientes.

-Formación:

-Técnica y en idiomas.

-Personalizada a tus necesidades.

-Plan de Conciliación.

-Modelo de teletrabajo híbrido.

Title: Data analyst F/H
Description:
About

Pour accompagner la mise en place du processus de planification des ventes et des opérations (Sales&Operation planning, S&OP), l’entité « cohérence stratégique » recherche un data analyst pour piloter et architecturer le référentiel data associé au S&OP et sa gouvernance, préparer les différentes reviews S&OP, suivre les indicateurs associés, et préparer des tableaux de bord de responsabilité « cohérence stratégique ».

En tant que data analyst, vous jouez un rôle clé dans la transformation de MBDA et sa capacité à prendre des décisions éclairées face aux défis géostratégiques actuels. Votre expertise permettra d’accompagner la croissance de l’entreprise et d’optimiser l’utilisation des données, notamment par le choix des outils et bases de données.

L’ Architecture / Gestion Des Données

En interface avec différentes directions (Sales, opérations, ingénierie, finance et IM) et les filiales de MBDA, vous aurez pour principales missions :

Structuration des différentes bases de données nécessaires au S&OP – définition des règles de gestion de structuration des différentes bases de données entre elles.

Gouvernance et architecture des données S&OP

Extraction des données nécessaires à l’analyse

Analyse des données

Définition des règles de gestion de nettoyage des bases de données

Maîtrise de la qualité des données tout au long de leur traitement.

Outil S&OP

Rédaction des besoins outil S&OP, test et recettes

Simulation de scénarios sur la base des données collectées et fiabilisées

Evaluation desdits scénarios

Processus S&OP

Préparation des « demand review », des « supply review » des « S&OP review » et du cascading des décisions prises en S&OP

Suivi des plans d’actions définis en fonction des simulations réalisées

Préparation et automatisation des tableaux de bords permettant notamment la mise en place de plans d’amélioration continue

Veille technologique sur les outils d’analyse de données

Effectuer une veille sur les nouvelles technologies et solutions logicielles d’analyse des données

Rechercher et expérimenter de nouvelles méthodes de modélisation et d’analyse des données

Sélectionner les nouveaux outils et techniques d’analyse des données

De formation Ingénieur ou équivalent, vous disposez d’une première expérience réussie dans le développement de solutions analytiques, dans un contexte industriel.

Vous avez grâce à vos compétences en gestion de projet, développé des compétences en IT, Data Analytique, Statistique qui vous permettent d’être à l’aise dans la construction de KPIs, dans la modélisation de la donnée, et dans l’utilisation des outils de Business Intelligence (Power BI, SAC, Qlikview …).

Vous disposez d’une maitrise des langages VBA et SQL et idéalement d’une connaissance de l’environnement SAP (SAP3, SAP4). Anglais courant souhaité.

Interfacer avec tous niveaux d’interlocuteurs métiers de l’entreprise dans le groupe

Rôle clé lors de présentations destinées notamment au CoDiR

Contexte International

Nice-to-have skills


Data Analytics
Statistics
Data Modeling
Business Intelligence
Power BI
SAP
VBA
SQL
Le Plessis-Robinson, Île-de-France, France


Work experience


Data Analyst


Languages


French
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About the Company




Safetykleen is a leading provider of Parts Washing, Waste Collection and Environmental Advisory services to businesses. Our operations encompass 12 European countries in addition to Brazil and Turkey. We have 19 branches across UK and Ireland, employing circ. 600 passionate and committed people. We are built on a strong business model, a winning culture and always putting customer at the heart of everything we do.




We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our team and support the Sales & Marketing strategy through data analysis. If you have experience with ERP, BI (Power BI), and SQL, this could be the perfect opportunity for you!




About the Role

What You’ll Do:




Extract and analyze data from our ERP, BI, and other sources to provide actionable insights
Build dashboards, reports, and KPIs to support decision-making
Identify trends and patterns in Sales, Marketing, and Customer data
Automate and optimize recurring reports to improve efficiency
Work closely with the commercial team to support business objectives




Responsibilities

Proven experience as a Data Analyst, preferably working with ERP system
Hands-on experience with BI tools (Power BI or similar) and SQL
Strong analytical mindset, able to deep dive into data and see the bigger picture
Fluent in Portuguese & English
The role requires a highly analytical person




What we Offer




Attractive salary package
Excellent team environment and workplace culture
Comprehensive insurance coverage
Competitive salary + daily meal allowance
Annual performance-based bonus

  • Annual performance-based bonus

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
A Job? Or a Lifetime Experience? Start Yours Here!




We are a Portuguese technology consulting company with a strong outward look to the rest of Europe. We have 10 years of experience in the market and reached the status of “large company” in 2018. We now have more than 350 associates and we keep growing, with offices in Lisbon, Porto, and Leiria, as well as projects in more than 20 countries. Our company is part of the national top 10, with a growth of 250% in the last years.




Work-life balance is part of our DNA. We focus on win-win-win relationships, defining every moment of interaction as an experience with unique conditions. Working with Affinity is a “Lifetime Experience” where you will have the opportunity to demonstrate all your potential and to be successful on every level.




#welcometoyourfuture




What you need to have/know:




Write SQL queries to extract and manipulate data from relational databases.
Work with different database engines (SQL Server, Oracle, MySQL, etc.).
Optimize queries to improve report performance.
Create interactive visualizations and dashboards in Power BI.
Strong experience in ETL processes and financial reporting using Microsoft technologies and relational databases such as PostgreSQL, SQL Server, and MySQL.
Experience in data ingestion and migration of legacy systems to next-generation platforms like Dremio, with analytics using BI tools, preferably Power BI.
Desirable experience in leadership and collaborating with cross-functional data teams, with expertise in both backend and frontend.




What will encourage you




Being part of a company that has a disruptive action in the technology market;
Being part of a technology focused on relationships, simplicity, and efficiency;
Accessing a generative career directly proportional to your performance and interest;
The real possibility of being part of our company staff.




Apply and Join Us!

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
En Keepler queremos hacer crecer nuestro equipo con personas que tengan ganas de desarrollar software basado en datos con dos objetivos: ayudar en la transformación a nuestros clientes y disfrutar del proceso de crear valor a través de la tecnología.




Si quieres ser parte de un equipo que te ofrecerá retos tecnológicos y que te exigirá una mejora y aprendizaje continuo, si no tienes miedo a reconocer errores y eres capaz de ser proactivo y tirar del carro cuando te toque, es posible que Keepler sea el sitio donde deberías trabajar. ¿Te interesa? Echa un vistazo a nuestra vacante de Senior Data Analyst.




¿Qué buscamos en ti?




Más de 5 años de experiencia como Data Analyst con un perfil analítico muy marcado.
Experiencia en herramientas de reporting (Power BI, QuickSight y/o Looker).
Alto conocimiento y experiencia en lenguaje SQL y con conocimiento en modelo de datos relacionales.
Capacidad para trabajar con negocio y para entender procesos complejos asociados con datos.
Experiencia en procesos de recogida de requerimientos para identificar y definir requisitos funcionales.
Buena capacidad de trabajo en equipo.
Inglés B2-C1, con fluidez a nivel hablado.




Deseable:




Conocimiento de las herramientas complementarias a PowerBI (DAX Studio, Tabular Editor)
Conocimientos sobre el diseño y optimización de bases de datos analíticas.
Conocimiento de servicios AWS (Athena, S3...), GCP (Bigquery) y/o Azure.
Experiencia con metodologías Agile.




¿Qué te ofrecemos en Keepler?




Un buen ambiente de trabajo junto a compañeros/as que son unos/as cracks en sus tecnologías y de quienes aprenderás cada día.
Tendrás un presupuesto personal anual de 2.000 euros para que lo dediques a formación y certificaciones.
Teletrabajo con asistencia flexible a la oficina. Nuestra oficina está situada en el centro de Madrid, lo que permite disfrutar de la ciudad en un entorno inmejorable y bien comunicado.
Ayuda económica mensual para consumibles del hogar derivados del teletrabajo.
Horario flexible de entrada y salida y flexibilidad en el almuerzo, para que tu vida personal y profesional encajen sin problema.
Jornada intensiva los viernes todo el año y los meses de julio y agosto.
Ayuda alimentaria de 11 euros al día que podrás recibir en ticket restaurante o en nómina, a tu elección.
Retribución flexible para tarjeta transporte, cheque guardería y seguro médico para familiares.
Formación inglés one-to-one gratis para ti, con 8 sesiones al mes en modalidad online.
Seguro médico privado con una amplia cobertura además de seguro dental y ventajas y precio reducido para tus familiares.
Una compañía con una cultura muy colaborativa que siempre piensa en hacerte la vida profesional más fácil para que solo te preocupes en hacer bien lo que te gusta.
Tendrás acompañamiento de un buddy los primeros meses para que te ayude en la adaptación.
Un ambiente solidario y transparente donde tus decisiones afectan a todos/as en la que prima la solidaridad contigo y con el que está a tu lado.




Así entendemos Keepler, ¿te animas a trabajar con nosotros/as?




We believe en el talento apasionado por la tecnología.




We want personas con diferentes cualidades, mentes inquietas y deseo de aprender, explorar e implementar nuevas tecnologías que aporten valor a cada proyecto.




We invest en el desarrollo continuo de nuestros profesionales.




We foster una cultura de equipo y generosidad.




Rango Salarial: 47.000 - 56.000 euros brutos/anuales + bono




El salario que te ofrecemos responde a un rango salarial que depende de tu experiencia.

Title: Data-analist
Description:
ORGANISATIE




Onze klant, Randstad Group, is een toonaangevende HR-dienstverlener die wereldwijd actief is. Met een sterke focus op innovatie en datagedreven oplossingen, speelt Randstad een sleutelrol in het vormgeven van de toekomst van werk. In België is de organisatie een gevestigde waarde met een uitgebreid netwerk en tal van ontwikkelingsmogelijkheden voor hun medewerkers.

Randstad staat voor een inclusieve cultuur waarin samenwerken en het stimuleren van groei centraal staan. Momenteel zoeken zij versterking in de rol van Data-Driven IT Project Manager om hun digitale transformatie verder vorm te geven.




FUNCTIE

In deze veelzijdige rol combineer je projectmanagement met data-analyse om datastrategieën te ontwikkelen en implementeren. Je staat in voor het coördineren van data-projecten en werkt nauw samen met interne en externe stakeholders om oplossingen op maat te realiseren.




Als IT Projectleider:

Je bepaalt de scope, doelstellingen, tijdslijnen en deliverables van projecten.
Je beheert budgetten/resources en coördineert met interne en externe teams.
Je anticipeert op risico’s, lost problemen op en bewaakt de kwaliteit van deliverables.
Je garandeert de naleving van richtlijnen inzake architectuur, beveiliging en privacy.

Als Analist Data:

Je werkt samen met business stakeholders om noden en uitdagingen in kaart te brengen.
Je vertaalt business requirements naar concrete oplossingen en zorgt ervoor dat business en IT gealigneerd zijn.
Je faciliteert workshops en overlegmomenten om de juiste beslissingen te nemen.
Je valideert of de opgeleverde producten voldoen aan de vooropgestelde verwachtingen en richtlijnen.
Je aligneert met de globale datastrategieën binnen Randstad Group.




PROFIEL

Master- of bachelordiploma met ervaring in grote(re) (dienstverlenende) ondernemingen of internationale groepen.
Ervaring met data principes en het opzetten van projecten of begeleiden van analyses.
Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden in zowel Nederlands als Engels.
Vermogen om relaties op te bouwen en te onderhouden, zowel lokaal als internationaal.
Pragmatische aanpak met focus op resultaten.







AANBOD

Het aanbod omvat een aantrekkelijk loonpakket met extralegale voordelen zoals maaltijdcheques, hospitalisatie- en groepsverzekering, bonussysteem, bedrijfswagen, flexibiliteit op vlak van werkplek en meer. Daarnaast krijg je ook de mogelijkheid om tot 3 dagen van thuis te werken.

Heb jij de juiste ervaring en motivatie om deze uitdagende rol aan te gaan? Solliciteer dan nu op florence.carlier@atrecruitment.be

Onze klant, Randstad Group, is een toonaangevende HR-dienstverlener die wereldwijd actief is. Met een sterke focus op innovatie en datagedreven oplossingen, speelt Randstad een sleutelrol in het vormgeven van de toekomst van werk. In België is de organisatie een gevestigde waarde met een uitgebreid netwerk en tal van ontwikkelingsmogelijkheden voor hun medewerkers.

Randstad staat voor een inclusieve cultuur waarin samenwerken en het stimuleren van groei centraal staan. Momenteel zoeken zij versterking in de rol van Data-Driven IT Project Manager om hun digitale transformatie verder vorm te geven.


FUNCTIE

In deze veelzijdige rol combineer je projectmanagement met data-analyse om datastrategieën te ontwikkelen en implementeren. Je staat in voor het coördineren van data-projecten en werkt nauw samen met interne en externe stakeholders om oplossingen op maat te realiseren.


Als IT Projectleider:

  • Je bepaalt de scope, doelstellingen, tijdslijnen en deliverables van projecten.
  • Je beheert budgetten/resources en coördineert met interne en externe teams.
  • Je anticipeert op risico’s, lost problemen op en bewaakt de kwaliteit van deliverables.
  • Je garandeert de naleving van richtlijnen inzake architectuur, beveiliging en privacy.

Als Analist Data:

  • Je werkt samen met business stakeholders om noden en uitdagingen in kaart te brengen.
  • Je vertaalt business requirements naar concrete oplossingen en zorgt ervoor dat business en IT gealigneerd zijn.
  • Je faciliteert workshops en overlegmomenten om de juiste beslissingen te nemen.
  • Je valideert of de opgeleverde producten voldoen aan de vooropgestelde verwachtingen en richtlijnen.
  • Je aligneert met de globale datastrategieën binnen Randstad Group.


PROFIEL

  • Master- of bachelordiploma met ervaring in grote(re) (dienstverlenende) ondernemingen of internationale groepen.
  • Ervaring met data principes en het opzetten van projecten of begeleiden van analyses.
  • Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden in zowel Nederlands als Engels.
  • Vermogen om relaties op te bouwen en te onderhouden, zowel lokaal als internationaal.
  • Pragmatische aanpak met focus op resultaten.



AANBOD

Het aanbod omvat een aantrekkelijk loonpakket met extralegale voordelen zoals maaltijdcheques, hospitalisatie- en groepsverzekering, bonussysteem, bedrijfswagen, flexibiliteit op vlak van werkplek en meer. Daarnaast krijg je ook de mogelijkheid om tot 3 dagen van thuis te werken.

Heb jij de juiste ervaring en motivatie om deze uitdagende rol aan te gaan? Solliciteer dan nu op florence.carlier@atrecruitment.be

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We offer:




• Join a best-in-class dynamic team that brings ideas, innovation and passion

• Work directly with senior management from various business units and support strategic objectives

• International, collaborative and creative environment

• Working on real business problems

• Contingent/Leased assignment working onsite at Morgan Stanley

• Contract via 3rd party agency




Key Responsibilities:




• Establish strong work relationships with team members across Wealth Management functions to support strategic initiatives

• Work with Digital Client Experience Platform (DCEP) teams and analytics partners to define measurement strategy based on product analytics requirements

• Understand business needs and convert them to data collection technical requirements

• Utilize proactive problem-solving and innovative thinking to address challanges

• Build, review and monitor data models and conduct analysis based on specific requirrements

• Build data visualizations for reporting to senior management

• Provide analytics and insights for various business initiatives and projects

• Prepare and deliver presentations to highlight important metrics and showcase achievemnts




Qualifications:




• 0-3 years of business analytics experience or experience with digital tools

• Highly motivated, detail-oriented self-starter personality with a strong sense of ownership, accountability, willingness to learn, high degree of curiosity and desire to succeed

• Advanced written and verbal communications in English

• Strong analytical mindset

• Strong sense of identifying priorities

• The ability to handle multiple tasks and projects concurrently

• Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to determine business partner needs and create purpose built solutions

• The ability to work collaboratively across multiple business units, teams job functions and geographical locations

• At least Bachelor’s Degree




You might also have:




• Experience with SPSS, R, SQL, DataIku

• Knowledge / Experience in Analytics

• Hands on experience utilizing digital tools (Adobe Analytics, Power BI, Google Analytics, etc.)

• Data visualization experience (Tableau, QlikView etc)




Department Profile:




The Analytics & Data (A&D) organization is a key growth area within Morgan Stanley’s Wealth Management Division, playing a critical role in the execution of the wider Wealth Management strategy. The use of analytics and data will be a key driver in accelerating growth across all client segments, enabling data-driven decision making and delivering the best client experience.




Team Profile:




The User Experience Data Collection Team is part of the Wealth Management Analytics & Data Organization at Morgan Stanley. The team drives strategy and execution of platforms that collect quantitative and qualitative data about user experience across Wealth Management properties and activities. The team’s responsibility is to support Wealth Managements strategic objectives through the use and exploitation of its data and analytical assets and manage digital surveys across business units throughout Morgan Stanley Wealth Management.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At ING we are looking for a Data Analyst




Your role and work environment:




We are looking for a talented and enthusiastic Data Analyst to join our Data Analyst team of Customer Interactions and Monetization Tribe.




Our mission is to enhance business performance through descriptive analytics and business diagnosis, providing insights and recommendations that facilitate better decision-making and lead to improved commercial outcomes.




We seek a dynamic and proactive individual who can engage with business areas, comprehend their needs, understand their services and products, and navigate the data ecosystem to produce precise and meaningful data-driven analyses.




We value a strong and honest team spirit, fostering an excellent and collaborative environment with business stakeholders and your fellow Data Analysts. This contributes to a robust and highly skilled data analyst community.




Your key responsibilities:




As a Data Analyst, you will:




Engage proactively with business areas to understand their business goals, financial services and products, to generate accurate data-driven business analyses and recommendations.

Analyzing product trends to increase sales conversion, reduce product attrition, improve digital funnels, and support communication campaigns. This involves identifying key performance indicators, monitoring product performance, and suggesting actionable insights to optimize sales strategies and customer experience.

Conducting customer analyses to determine customer lifetime value, customer segmentation, and forecast customer development. This includes using analytical techniques to identify patterns and trends in customer data, enabling the business to tailor its marketing and retention strategies effectively.

Supporting and advising the business on reporting needs and other analytical requirements. This entails collaborating with stakeholders to define reporting metrics, coordinate the development of comprehensive dashboards to ensure data-driven business monitoring and decision-making.




Additionally, you will collaborate closely with your Data Analyst teammates to foster a robust and highly skilled data analyst community. This involves sharing best practices, participating in knowledge-sharing sessions, and contributing to a culture of continuous improvement and excellence.







What are we looking for?




Want to know if this job is made for you? These are some of the qualities that we value the most for this role. And if the shoe fits… don’t hesitate to apply!




Willing to assume challenges, take initiative and personal responsibility.

Desirable thinking in strategic terms. Able to recognize key information, identify business opportunities, establish connections and apply analytics for decision-making.

Willing to learn and improve your technical and your interpersonal skills.

Diven and customer-focused, always striving to understand and meet the needs of the business and its clients.

Bachelor’s degree in mathematics, statistics, computer science, economics, or other degree with strong analytical content.

Full proficiency in Excel, SAS and SQL

At least 5 years of experience in a comparable role, transforming data to extract key business insights. Experience in retail banking is highly recommended

Your communication skills enable you to work together with many different parties throughout our organization. Negotiation and stakeholder management

Fluent English will be appreciated.







What do we offer?




The time you spend at work, the challenges you face or the lessons you get are very important, but… What about your personal life? At ING we want your work to fulfill you in every way, and that is why we take care of even the smallest details.




Check out what is waiting for you!




Be flexible my friend.

Our model is all about flexibility and accountability. Keeping both our customers and our colleagues needs in mind, you determine together which days you work at home and which you come to ING MAD to offer your best self. Do your thing.

Restaurant card.

So that thinking about what to have for lunch doesn’t take up your time or your cravings.

Our house will be your home.

In our offices you can find electric mobility solutions, doctor, hairdresser, gym, The Good Service (to help you with your errands) and much more!

Health insurance.

For you and all your family (spouse/partner and children).




Life insurance.

We help you protect what matters most to you.

Flexible remuneration.

In addition, you will enjoy our flexible remuneration model, through a more tax-advantaged way, you will be able to access other services such as nursery, transport card, training aids…

Free company shuttle.

It doesn't matter where you live. We have 6 routes (North, Central, South, A5, A42 and A6) to get you to our ING office in Madrid comfortably.

Banking benefits.

Special loans with more beneficial conditions.

Special mortgage conditions after 6 months working at the bank.

And you can benefit from our pension plan after 1 month with us!

More vitality and more belonging

360º care of the employee (physical, mental, social connection & purpose).

Physiotherapy service on site.

Runners club with your own trainer.

Clinics with professional, world-class athletes.

Gympass service.

Employee Networks: Rainbow Lions (LGBTQI+) & Leonas.







Get to know Us




We are a team of more than 1600 people sharing one idea: doing our bit in helping our clients create a better future for themselves, by providing them with the tools they need to get where they want to go.




A fully online bank where technology, innovation, simplicity and transparency are the main ingredients, and the first one to work with agile methodologies.




And although we are based in Spain, we are lucky to work in an international bank with presence in more than 40 countries.




We are proud to have a diverse team and we are committed to continue developing a culture of Diversity, Inclusion and Belonging to foster a culture of collaboration and innovation that represents all collectives in the society.




And even though we look orange on the outside, we are green on the inside. Our ambition in Sustainability is Empowering (y)our Sustainability journey. We are embarking on our path, for us, but we are also there for when our clients decide to embark on this journey.




Making things happen, helping others be successful, always being one step ahead—that’s our DNA. If you look at yourself in the mirror and your reflection matches our way of being and working…we are looking forward to meeting you!
