Title: Data Analyst
Description:
📊 ¡Únete a nuestro equipo como Data Analyst y potencia la estrategia con datos! 🚀




¿Eres un apasionado del análisis de datos y la inteligencia de negocio? ¿Te encanta transformar números en estrategias y optimizar el rendimiento? Si buscas un entorno dinámico en el sector turístico donde cada análisis impacta directamente en la toma de decisiones… ¡Esta es tu oportunidad!




🔍 Tu misión como Data Analyst




Analizar indicadores clave (Ocupación, ADR, Ingresos, RevPAR) y proporcionar insights estratégicos.
Diseñar y mantener dashboards y reportes para los equipos de Ventas, Marketing, Operaciones y Revenue Management.
Identificar tendencias de mercado y comportamiento de clientes para mejorar la estrategia comercial.
Evaluar y optimizar el rendimiento de los canales de venta (Directo, TT.OO, OTAs).
Automatizar informes y procesos para agilizar la toma de decisiones.
Investigar fuentes externas como INE, Exceltur y asociaciones hoteleras para enriquecer el análisis.
Presentar hallazgos clave a la dirección mediante informes y visualizaciones impactantes.
Coordinación entre departamento de Paris HQ, con IT y con otros data’s analyst
NPS análisis a través de la plataforma de Medallia.




🎯 Lo que buscamos en ti




Formación en ADE, Turismo o similar.
Experiencia de al menos 2 años en análisis de datos, preferiblemente en turismo, hotelería o distribución digital.
Dominio de herramientas como Excel avanzado, Power BI, Tableau.
Capacidad de estructurar información, extraer insights y comunicar hallazgos de manera efectiva.
Pasión por la mejora continua, nuevas tecnologías y optimización de procesos.
Trabajo en equipo y excelentes habilidades comunicativas.
Inglés avanzado (otros idiomas son un plus).




✨ Valoramos positivamente:




Conocimientos en Google Analytics, Revenue Management y estrategias de pricing.
Familiaridad con PMS y plataformas de distribución hotelera.
Experiencia previa en sectores como aéreo, turismo o viajes.




🎁 Lo que ofrecemos




Formar parte de una empresa líder en el sector turístico.
Contrato fijo indefinido y estabilidad laboral.
1 día de teletrabajo semanal + jornada flexible.
Tickets restaurant y beneficios adicionales.
Descuentos exclusivos en alojamientos de la cadena.
Ambiente dinámico, innovador y lleno de oportunidades de crecimiento.










📢 ¿Listo para impulsar la estrategia con datos y marcar la diferencia? ¡Aplica ahora y conviértete en parte de nuestro equipo! 🚀

Title: Data Analyst - Power BI
Description:
Seleccionamos para nuestro departamento de Consultoría una Bussines Data Analyst - Power BI para nuestra oficina de Barcelona.







Vilar Riba somos una organización de asesoramiento global en los ámbitos fiscal, legal, laboral, consultoría, auditoria y M&A. Contamos con un equipo de más de 175 profesionales especializados y con una trayectoria de más de 30 años de experiencia. También formamos parte de la red Geneva Group Internacional (GGI) la sexta firma mundial de servicios profesionales a empresas.




Principales funciones

-Definición e implantación de cuadros de mando para las distintas áreas de la empresa mediante la utilización de las herramientas Business Intelligence de Microsoft Power BI.

-Obtención de datos, análisis y procesamiento de los mismos.

-Analizar y definir estrategia e identificar nuevas oportunidades

de negocio.

-Comunicación constante con cliente para la toma de requerimientos,

validación y soporte en la utilización.




Requisitos

-Formación de ingeniería, ADE o similar.

-3 años de experiencia en Proyectos de Business Intelligence.

-Experiencia en MS Power BI, lenguaje DAX, configuración de Data Gateway y funcionalidades de PowerQuery.

-Perfil analítico, dinámico y riguroso, acostumbrado a manejar y analizar indicadores de gestión de negocio.

-Valorable buen nivel de inglés.




Ofrecemos

-Proyección profesional basada en la continua adquisición de

conocimientos y experiencia participando en proyectos en organizaciones de

primer nivel.

-Excelente ambiente de trabajo.

-Formar parte de un equipo joven, motivado y altamente

especializado.

-Asumir responsabilidades con clientes.

-Formación:

-Técnica y en idiomas.

-Personalizada a tus necesidades.

-Gestionar proyectos con empresas lideres de la comarca.

-Modelo de teletrabajo híbrido.

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Cosa Farai In Quanto Data Analyst

  • Conoscerai e parteciperai alla selezione delle fonti di dati più appropriate per le finalità della nostra organizzazione, garantendo un flusso costante di informazioni rilevanti;
  • Sarai coinvolto nella progettazione e governance di interventi completi per l'acquisizione, elaborazione, integrazione e analisi dei dati, contribuendo alla creazione di solide basi informative;
  • Parteciperai alle attività di implementazione e gestione delle soluzioni legate al Forecast della domanda/immissione presso i clienti del settore Power & Gas;
  • Utilizzerai linguaggi quali Python o R per l’analisi dei dati;
  • Avrai l'opportunità di comprendere e analizzare il funzionamento dei mercati Utility, nonché di esplorare il potenziale strategico della Business Analytics;

L'esperienza e le abilità che ti rendono la persona giusta:

  • Laurea in discipline STEM preferibilmente con indirizzi o specializzazioni legate al mondo Data;
  • Conoscenza base SQL ed utilizzo di client tool SQL;
  • Buona conoscenza pacchetto Office, in particolare Excel;
  • Passione per l'analisi dei dati e desiderio di apprendere e crescere nel campo;
  • Conoscenza a livello universitario di Python, e/o R, e/o Matlab;
  • Conoscenza ottima della lingua inglese;

Le Caratteristiche Che Ti Fanno Spiccare Tra i Candidati

  • Capacità di comunicare in modo chiaro ed efficace con diversi stakeholder;
  • Orientamento ai dettagli e capacità di problem solving;
  • Esperienza professionale pregressa in linea in società di prodotto e/o consulenza diretta al cliente;
  • Esperienza accademica o professionale di utilizzo di strumenti di Business intelligence; Conoscenza del settore Power & Gas;

Mindset.

Le persone che lavorano con noi non sono “dipendenti”, sono talenti che contribuiscono, ciascuno nel proprio settore, alla creazione di un luogo senza confini spaziali e mentali, dove aspirazioni, obiettivi, entusiasmi e strategie si fondono in un percorso virtuoso di evoluzione condivisa, per crescere ed esprimere il massimo del proprio potenziale.

Il gruppo Symphonie ha creato un ambiente di lavoro in cui ogni persona ha la possibilità di esprimere e sviluppare le proprie potenzialità a pieno. Promuoviamo l'indifferenza di genere, età, cultura, lingua, religione, idee politiche, orientamento sessuale, abilità psicofisiche, condizioni personali e sociali, mettendo in primo piano le persone, i loro meriti, le loro abilità e la loro passione.

Title: Consultant Data Intelligence - H/F - CDI
Description:
Talan est un groupe international de conseil et d’expertises technologiques qui accélère la transformation de ses clients par les leviers de l'innovation, la technologie et la data.



Depuis plus de 20 ans, Talan conseille et accompagne les entreprises et les institutions publiques dans la mise en œuvre de leurs projets de transformation et d'innovation en France et à l'international.



Présent dans 20 pays, le Groupe, certifié Great Place To Work, qui compte plus de 7200 collaborateurs, ambitionne de dépasser la barre du milliard d'euros à horizon 2025.



Nous accompagnons les entreprises dans des secteurs variés : énergie, industrie, transport, finance, luxe… à travers 3 grandes expertises :




Le Conseil en Management et Innovation (320 Consultants en France)






La valorisation des données, leurs structurations, et leurs usages (Data et Technologies)






L’intégration de solutions logicielles (Cloud et Applications Services)






Nos valeurs : engagement, respect, partage, esprit d’équipe et optimisme.



Talan est une entreprise responsable, reconnue par ses collaborateurs et attachée à la diversité.



Retrouvez nos engagements RSE ici et nos actions en faveur de la diversité ici



Des aménagements peuvent être proposés si vous êtes en situation de handicap.




Description du poste


Si vous recherchez un univers 100% Data, bienvenue au sein du pôle Data Intelligence Solutions - LE pôle Data du groupe Talan !



VOTRE ROLE SUR NOS PROJETS :



Au sein d’équipes projets, vous pourrez être en charge des missions suivantes :



- Pilotage de projets d’envergure dans des écosystèmes Data/Big Data/Cloud



- Cadrage du besoin, conception et analyses fonctionnelle et technique



- Benchmark de solutions et conseil auprès de nos clients sur les solutions technologiques à adopter, en lien avec leurs besoins



- Conseil sur l’architecture, l’exploitation et la gouvernance des données



- Maîtrise complète de la plateforme, installation et dimensionnement



- Création d’applications, manipulation de la donnée, modélisation et développement de rapports et tableaux de bord



- Rédaction de documentation fonctionnelle et/ou technique



- Formation d’utilisateurs(rices) et équipe projet



- Participation à des avant-ventes



VOTRE ROLE CHEZ TALAN :



- Réalisation de POC (Proof Of Concept)



- Être ambassadeur(drice) en participant à des événements partenaires



- Participation à des projets internes et partage de connaissances au sein de nos équipes.



#TalanFrance




Qualifications


VOTRE PROFIL :



De formation Bac+5, vous disposez d’une expérience confirmée de minimum 5 ans dans la data et disposez des compétences suivantes :



- Vous avez développé une expertise technique et fonctionnelle sur l’une des technologies suivantes : MSBI, Power BI, Tableau, Informatica, Talend, Dbt, Hadoop, Spark, Scala, Hive, Kafka, Snowflake, Azure DB, AWS, GCP, Redshift, Athena, TM1, Jedox, Big Query, Looker…



- Vous maîtrisez les concepts de base de l'informatique décisionnelle (modélisation, alimentation, restitution...) et/ou du big data



- Vous avez déjà préparé et mené des ateliers métiers



- Vous êtes capable d’appréhender le contexte métier



- La connaissance du contrôle de gestion est un plus



- Vous avez formé des utilisateurs et équipes projet



- Une ou plusieurs certifications seraient fortement appréciées



- Français lu, écrit, parlé



- L'anglais est un plus.



VOTRE SOUHAIT D’EVOLUTION :

Si vous êtes passionné(e) par l’innovation, et souhaitez élargir vos compétences technico-fonctionnelles dans la data, accéder à des fonctions de management de projet et d’équipe, participer au développement commercial et organisationnel, ou tout simplement pouvoir valoriser vos prises d’initiatives et développer de nouveaux terrains de jeux, alors rejoignez-nous !





Show more
HTML:
Talan est un groupe international de conseil et d’expertises technologiques qui accélère la transformation de ses clients par les leviers de l'innovation, la technologie et la data.



Depuis plus de 20 ans, Talan conseille et accompagne les entreprises et les institutions publiques dans la mise en œuvre de leurs projets de transformation et d'innovation en France et à l'international.



Présent dans 20 pays, le Groupe, certifié Great Place To Work, qui compte plus de 7200 collaborateurs, ambitionne de dépasser la barre du milliard d'euros à horizon 2025.



Nous accompagnons les entreprises dans des secteurs variés : énergie, industrie, transport, finance, luxe… à travers 3 grandes expertises :



  • Le Conseil en Management et Innovation (320 Consultants en France)





  • La valorisation des données, leurs structurations, et leurs usages (Data et Technologies)





  • L’intégration de solutions logicielles (Cloud et Applications Services)





Nos valeurs : engagement, respect, partage, esprit d’équipe et optimisme.



Talan est une entreprise responsable, reconnue par ses collaborateurs et attachée à la diversité.



Retrouvez nos engagements RSE ici et nos actions en faveur de la diversité ici

Title: Analista de Visualización de Datos Junior
Description:
Buscamos un Analista de Visualización de Datos con formación en ingeniería, habilidades intermedias en Power BI y Excel, y un nivel intermedio de inglés. Este profesional será responsable de desarrollar informes detallados y cuadros de mando de KPI para clientes, con un enfoque en análisis y claridad visual.




Responsabilidades:

Diseñar, desarrollar y mantener dashboards interactivos en Power BI.

Elaborar informes detallados y cuadros de mando de KPI que faciliten la toma de decisiones para los clientes.

Analizar datos y generar insights para mejorar la interpretación de los informes.

Colaborar con los clientes para entender sus necesidades de reportes y personalizarlos según sus requisitos.

Gestionar y organizar datos utilizando Excel, asegurando la calidad y consistencia de la información.

Identificar oportunidades de mejora en los procesos de análisis y visualización de datos.




Requisitos:

Formación en Ingeniería (o equivalente).

Conocimientos avanzados de Power BI y Excel.

Nivel intermedio de inglés (capacidad para leer, redactar y mantener conversaciones básicas).

Habilidades analíticas y atención al detalle.

Capacidad para trabajar de manera autónoma y en equipo.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We have partnered with a global organisation on this exciting opportunity. The successful data analyst will support internal projects across multiple areas, gathering market intelligence and data to assist in developing strategies and driving cost efficiencies.




This is a permanent role with a hybrid working model. This would suit someone with 5 years plus of data experience and you would need to be based in Cork.




Key Responsibilities:

Provide live, monthly, and quarterly reports.
Engage and collaborate with internal and external stakeholders.
Collect and analyze data to update reports, KPIs, and dashboards.
Manage and maintain contract information for compliance.
Maintain and manage data platforms and data systems.
Ensure compliance with policies and procedures.
Identify and implement process improvements to enhance efficiency.




Qualifications & Skills:

Strong analytical and data management skills.
Ability to work collaboratively across teams.
Proficiency in data systems and reporting tools is essesntial such as Excel, PowerBI, SQL, etc
Attention to detail and organizational skills.
Ability to take ownership of his/ her own remit.
Strong stakeholder management experience is essential.
Experience in data analysis, procurement, or supply chain is preferred.




This is an exciting opportunity to develop data expertise in a dynamic and fast-paced environment.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst Intern
Description:
About Royaltyport:

Royaltyport assists artists and their managers in managing their music business intelligently. Our mission is to ensure artists understand their rights and income, receiving fair compensation. Founded by seasoned entrepreneurs with extensive music industry expertise, Royaltyport has recently launched its product and is already collaborating with artists like Sam Feldt, Purple Disco Machine, Oliver Heldens, and John Newman.




About You:

We’re looking for a passionate data analyst intern to join our team. You’ll collaborate closely with seasoned startup founders, experienced engineers, and our expert data lead.




Musicians receive revenue reports in various formats and from multiple sources. Your role will involve identifying errors in the data and visualising it in a way that is clear and actionable for our artists. This could involve areas of underpayment, errors in royalty calculations, or missing payments altogether. You will focus on both novel and common reporting errors in the industry. Additionally, you will become an expert on different types of royalties and develop expertise in musical earnings over the course of your internship.




We’re seeking someone who learns quickly and is eager to dive in and make a meaningful impact. If you’re not afraid to roll up your sleeves and want to play a role in a changing industry, we’d love to hear from you.




Requirements:

Must-Have:
Students pursuing an academic university degree or recent graduates in econometrics, data science, statistics, or computer/information sciences.
Strong knowledge of SQL.
Strong analytical capabilities.
Eligibility to work in the Netherlands.
Bonus Points For:
Experience with Looker Studio or visualisation platforms like PowerBi or Tableau.
Experience in Python.
Any analytical work experience.
Any kind of pre existing knowledge on music royalties.




Our Ideal Candidate:

Believes in our mission.
Able to work independently.
Thrives in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
Is available at least 3 days a week, and can frequently come to our office in Amsterdam.
Is available for at least 4 months.
Passion for music and the music industry is a plus, though not required.
Proficiency in Dutch is a plus, though not required.




What We Offer:

An opportunity to work in the music industry and gain a unique peek behind the curtain.
An internship allowance of €500,-.
Learn for experienced data professionals and startup founders.




What’s next:

If you’re excited about this opportunity, send your information to hello@royaltyport.com. Sharing previous work, if applicable, is highly encouraged. The first step is an initial online meeting. We might ask you to do a technical test, depending on your level of experience.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Permanent position only




WHAT IS CREAM ALL ABOUT?

We could be a Cream Factory, a cooking blog or even a detective agency…but in reality, we are a consulting company in Business & Technology active in large organizations and industry leaders in Banking, Insurance, Telecom, Energy, Pharmaceutical & Transport.




CREAM’S SPECIAL RECIPE:

1/3 of Personal development
1/3 of Collective Intelligence
1/3 of Intrapreneurship

Bonus ingredient: … Some passionate colleagues 😀




WHAT IS A BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE ANALYST AT CREAM?

As Jean, Business Analyst Business Intelligence, translate the BI needs of the business teams in specifications for the IT department, for both small demands or as part of larger projects (contributions or BI project).




YOUR TASKS :

Act as person of contact between Business Engineering Teams and the Development Team
Define the business specifications for BI needs
Participation in (or management of) BI projects, or on the BI tracks of other projects for the engineering activities (requirement definition, impact analysis, process definition), while representing the BI vision (and BI target architecture) that has been defined
Collaboration with data delivery experts to deliver on projects
Understand business requirements and build a functional analysis which covers needs of the business according to our BI reference architecture
Collaborate with the development team




HOW DO WE IMAGINE OUR FUTURE CONSULTANT?

You have a Master degree in Computer Sciences or equivalent by experience
You have good knowledge in BI techniques and tools (BO, SAS, Cognos...)
You have a cultural openness and adaptability, you are rigorous, customer oriented, and you have high communication skills and analytical skills
You are polyvalent and can adapt easily to quickly changing environment
You are capable to think out of the box and maintain in the meantime a pragmatic approach
You are able to work with autonomy while being also a great team player
You are fluent in French and English; a good knowledge of Dutch is also required
You are committed to travelling abroad occasionally upon the client’s request

Bonus

An experience in concepts: ETL, DWHSE, data & process mining, reporting… could be a real asset




WHY SHOULD YOU TASTE CREAM/THE LIME FLAVOUR?

A broad diversity of career options: you’re not stuck in a box
You evolve in a learning environment where you can challenge your knowledge with your colleagues
You grow in a company that is at the leading edge of technology
You have the opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving company
We have values we share, live with, experiment every day
We just hire great people and give them the playing field to become awesome!




"THE LITTLE THING THAT CAN MAKE THE DIFFERENCE,

CREAM IS DEVELOPING A DIVERSITY PLAN AND WOULD LIKE THAT ALL ITS MEMBERS REFLECT THE SOCIETY IN ALL ITS DIVERSITY"

Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst (All Genders)
Description:
Dailymotion is more than a video app, it's a visual conversation in motion, based on a unique algorithm designed to broaden users' horizons. Dailymotion brings nuance to the debates that animate young people and puts listening, discovery, and kindness back at the heart of interactions to help build a better and safer Internet.



Dailymotion is also "Dailymotion for Enterprise", a video hosting and broadcasting solution for professionals in all sectors; and "Dailymotion Advertising", a powerful, proprietary video advertising platform, offering a high-quality, secure environment for brands.



Our team is made up of 400 people in France, New York, and Singapore, all united by the same ambition: to visibly shake up the global video platform ecosystem.





Job Description



As a Senior Data Analyst in the Insights & Data Solutions team at Dailymotion Advertising, you'll be at the heart of business strategy and data analytics. You'll work with various stakeholders and lead junior analysts to develop and improve business analysis frameworks for our global advertising clients, including those in FR, EMEA, APAC, US, and LATAM.



You'll create and maintain advanced tools, methods, and guidelines that support our sales and marketing teams. You'll drive new data opportunities, develop prototypes, and provide actionable insights to optimize campaign measurement and audience targeting.



Key Responsibilities:



Develop advanced analysis frameworks and interactive dashboards for various insight products (post-campaign analysis, pre-campaign planning, and audience profiling) tailored to different market needs.
Create and execute a roadmap to meet the team's data needs, including exploring opportunities for external collaboration.
Conceptualize and start data projects with tech, product, and core data teams to enhance insights and marketing strategies.
Manage and mentor a team of data analysts, fostering a collaborative and innovative environment.
Use Dailymotion's diverse data sources to identify new features, create prototypes, and deliver proof of concepts that improve insight products.
Document new features and processes thoroughly. Provide onboarding and ongoing training for teams to use data and insights effectively.


Qualifications


Experience: 3-5 years in data analysis, preferably in media agencies, ad tech companies, marketing analytics, or related fields. Proven ability to make data-driven business decisions and provide strategic recommendations.
Technical Skills: Advanced expertise in BigQuery, SQL, Data Studio, Tableau, and Python.
Digital Marketing Knowledge: Deep understanding of digital marketing and advertising, including clustering, targeting techniques, persona creation, market research, and consumer behavior analysis.
Attention to Detail & Problem-Solving: Exceptional attention to detail and problem-solving skills. Ability to translate business needs into data requirements and vice versa.
Project Management & Autonomy: Strong project management skills with the ability to work independently and ability to manage uncertainities.
Education: BS or MS in a quantitative field, management, or equivalent experience.


Additional Information



At Dailymotion, we empower candidates to take action. If this job sounds like a great opportunity for you, be confident in your skills, we are always happy to meet you! If needed, we can accommodate our recruitment process for your special abilities.



Additional Information



Location:
Start Date:
Contract Type:

🔍Want to learn more about us:



Dailymotion.com
Dailymotion Advertising
New-York office - BuiltIn
Offices in France - Welcome to the Jungle
Our articles

For the France offices



🏡Hybrid Work Framework (4 types of remote work : Full office /Flex office (1 to 2 days remote) / Flex remote (1 to 2 days at the office) / Full remote + ability to work 3 month abroad)
💰 Saving Plan Vivendi
🍼 Paternity leave or Coparental leave extended
🕶️ Living Employee Culture (Events / Trainings / Partys / All hands / Dailymotion tradition…)
🚀 Career development support (training / internal mobility / compensation cycle / 360 quarter feedback review …)
🏥 High-end Health Insurance and Personal Services Vouchers (CESU)
⛱️ Paid Time off – RTT and Saving time plan (CET)
✅ Meal Vouchers – Public Transport and Bike refund
🎡 European Economic and Social Committee (sport membership/cinemas vouchers/gift vouchers/discount)
⚽Fitness Subscription thanks to our partnership with Gymlib

  • ✅ Meal Vouchers – Public Transport and Bike refund
  • 🎡 European Economic and Social Committee (sport membership/cinemas vouchers/gift vouchers/discount)
  • ⚽Fitness Subscription thanks to our partnership with Gymlib

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data & AI Analyst - Data Management - Azure - Power BI - SQL




Responsibilities

Proactively oversee and coordinate complex data from multiple sources, supporting and enhancing our core professional services.
Collaborate with data architects and engineers to establish efficient data interfaces, ensure smooth data integration, and organize data into a unified schema.
Partner with data domain owners to maintain data integrity and ensure alignment with business goals, driving value creation for both clients and employees.
Assist data stewards by providing frameworks and tools that help maintain high data quality standards.
Analyse and prepare data for internal reporting and client-facing purposes.
Lead the successful integration of AI across the clients core services.
Contribute to embedding AI models into existing systems and workflows.
Ensure smooth deployment of AI solutions and monitor their performance.




Key skills and Knowledge

2+ years of work experience managing data in a highly regulated environment setting
A bachelor's or master's degree in a field with a high exposure to data analytics, such as computer science, applied mathematics, or another
proficiency with programming languages such as Python, R, and SQL
Proficiency in Microsoft Azure AI/ML tools
A solid grasp and admiration of data management frameworks
BI tools like Tableau, Power BI (the preferable option), etc.
Proficiency in Power Query/Pivot, SQL, and Excel macros

Show more

Title: Analista de datos SQL/PowerBI
Description:
NTT DATA BPO, es una sociedad perteneciente al grupo NTT DATA, la cual presta servicios de externalización de procesos de negocio. NTT DATA es una consultora multinacional que ofrece soluciones de negocio, estrategia, desarrollo y mantenimiento de aplicaciones tecnológicas, y outsourcing. La compañía, desarrolla su actividad en los sectores de telecomunicaciones, entidades financieras, industria, utilities, energía, administración pública y sanidad.




Somos la sexta compañía de servicios IT del mundo, lo que nos permite dar soluciones y servicios en diversas áreas, aumentando las capacidades, recursos tecnológicos, geográficos y financieros de nuestros clientes, además de ayudarles dando las respuestas más innovadoras.




Somos una de las pocas compañías en España, con los estándares más altos de excelencia en las condiciones que ofrecemos a nuestros empleados, por eso estamos certificados como Top Employer desde 2016 hasta la actualidad. Apostamos por nuestros empleados y creemos por encima de todo en las personas y en su desarrollo integral, por lo que fomentamos un contexto de libertad responsable que se traduce en un alto rendimiento profesional.




Para nuestra oficina de Madrid buscamos una persona con experiencia en análisis de datos y reporting, cuyas funciones serán apoyar en soluciones automatización de procesos web y entornos colaborativos que permitan la automatización de tareas administrativas.




Conocimientos necesarios:




Conocimiento de bases de datos y modelos de datos.
Conocimiento de SQL y PowerBI.
Experiencia en la explotación, análisis y construcción de reporting.
Experiencia soluciones de grabación de interacciones o similares.




Te ofrecemos formar parte del equipo de profesionales de NTT DATA BPO , lo que significa que desde el primer día ponemos todos los mecanismos necesarios en funcionamiento para que tengas un plan de carrera y formación especializada para el desempeño de tus funciones profesionales:




Contrato Indefinido.
Plan de Carrera profesional en función de la formación, experiencia, potencial profesional y expectativas del candidato.
Formación desde el primer día dirigida a la especialización técnica y de transformación digital.
Salario en función de la experiencia del candidato.
Horario Lunes a Viernes : de 8:00 a 17:00 (con hora para comer).
Modelo Híbrido.
Integrarte en una compañía multinacional líder (Una de las 10 compañías más grandes del sector a nivel mundial), joven y dinámica.
Formar parte de un ambiente creativo y colaborador donde puedes disfrutar de la experiencia del trabajo en equipo para lograr el máximo valor para nuestros clientes.
Trabajar en una empresa en constante evolución y crecimiento, realizando un trabajo enriquecedor con grandes oportunidades de desarrollo profesional.
Participación en proyectos innovadores y punteros para grandes clientes de primer nivel en distintos sectores de mercado.




Si eres una persona con buena comunicación, proactiva, que se sienta cómoda trabajando en equipo, no dudes en aplicar.

Title: (Junior) Data Analyst (w/m/d)
Description:
About

Herzlich Willkommen bei der MSR Consulting Group.

Als führende Unternehmensberatung begleiten wir Klienten aus den Branchen Automotive & Mobility sowie Financial Services und Industrial Goods auf ihrem Weg zum Best-in-Class. Unser Ziel: Die Welt für Kunden besser machen.

Bei uns erwartet dich Teamgeist, eigenverantwortliches Arbeiten und gemeinsame Entwicklung. Mit einer kununu-Bewertung von 4,4 von 5 sind wir stolz auf die Zufriedenheit unserer Mitarbeitenden und unsere offene Unternehmenskultur.

Werde Teil unseres Teams und gestalte mit uns die Zukunft!

(Junior) Data Analyst (w⁠/⁠m⁠/⁠d)

Arbeitsort: Köln | Full-time employee | AB SOFORT

So kann Deine Arbeiswoche bei uns aussehen

Intensive Python-Schulung

Erstellung eines Fragebogens für eine Kundenzufriedenheitsstudie

Online-Termin mit einem externen Felddienstleister zur Umsetzung einer Befragung

Team-Meeting im Büro zum Projektupdate

Bereinigung und Quality-Check von bereitgestellten Kundendaten

Auswertungen der Befragungsdaten und Ermittlung von Service-Level-Standards

Treiberanalysen mit Hilfe multivariater Regressionsanalysen zur Identifikation der wichtigsten Handlungsfelder

Erstellung einer Ergebnis-Präsentation in PowerPoint für einen Klienten mit konkreten Lösungsansätzen

Interne Weiterbildung zum Thema „Gewichtung in der Marktforschung“ und persönliches Treffen mit den Kolleg*innen im Büro

Darauf kannst Du Dich bei MSR freuen

Spannende Projekte: Unbefristeter Job, abwechslungsreiche Aufgaben und schnelle Verantwortung für eigene Aufgaben

Teamarbeit: Kurze Wege, regelmäßiger Austausch und Feedback

Top Einarbeitung: Individuelles Onboarding mit Mentor und monatliche Weiterbildungen an der MSR Academy

Entwicklung: Halbjährliche Mitarbeitergespräche und klare Karriereschritte

Attraktive Vergütung: Systematische Gehaltsentwicklung, Deutschlandticket & Firmenbike sowie Bezuschussung zum Urban Sport Club

Teamgeist: Jährliches Europa-Seminar, Team-Events & Feel Good-Aktivitäten

Flexibilität: Modernes Büro mit großem Garten, Home-Office-Möglichkeit, flexible Arbeitszeiten

Work-Life-Balance: 29 Tage Urlaub zzgl. Rosenmontag sowie die Option auf Sabbatical und weitere freie Tage

… und selbstverständlich dürfen auch bei uns kostenloser Kaffee, Tee und der wöchentliche bunte Obstkorb nicht fehlen

Das bringst Du idealerweise mit

Sehr gut abgeschlossenes Studium mit Bezug zu statistischen/ empirischen Inhalten

(Erste) Erfahrungen in der Anwendung von multivariaten Analyseverfahren

Du hast erste Kenntnisse in einer Statistiksoftware wie SPSS/ STATA oder einer Programmiersprache wie z.B. Python, R oder VBA gesammelt (kein Muss)

Falls Du bereits eigene Projekte als Showcase umgesetzt hast (z.B. auf GitHub), teile diese gerne mit uns

Du arbeitest eigenständig, verbindlich sowie lösungsorientiert und bist interessiert, technische Kompetenzen zu entwickeln

Fließende Deutschkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift sind unbedingt erforderlich

Kontakt

Teresa Höhl (Talent Acquisition + Employer Branding)

Tel.: 0221 4892813

Mail.: teresa.hoehl(at)msr.de


Cologne, North Rhine-Westphalia, Germany


Languages


German

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
FP Markets Group of Companies is a well-established globally regulated Australian broker offering traders access to CFDs across Forex, Indices, Commodities, Stocks and Cryptocurrencies. We are growing and looking to recruit a Full-Time Data Analyst in our Cyprus office - a certified Great Place to Work®.


We are seeking a detail-oriented and analytical Data Analyst with expertise in Power BI to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for analyzing data, generating reports, and building dashboards to support business decision-making. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to transform data into actionable insights.


Responsibilities:

Design, develop, and maintain interactive Power BI dashboards and reports to visualize business data
Analyze complex datasets to provide actionable insights and recommendations
Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand reporting requirements and translate them into efficient data models
Optimize Power BI solutions for performance and scalability
Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and security across all reporting solutions
Automate and streamline reporting processes to improve efficiency
Conduct ad-hoc data analysis and support business teams with data-driven decision-making



Candidate profile:

Bachelor's degree in Data Analytics, Computer Science, Business Intelligence, Statistics, or a related field
Proven experience as a Data Analyst, BI Analyst, or a similar role
Strong expertise in Microsoft Power BI, including DAX, Power Query (M), and Power BI Service
Knowledge of Excel (Advanced Formulas, Pivot Tables, Power Pivot, Power Query)
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail
Excellent communication and presentation skills to explain data insights to non-technical stakeholders
Ability to work independently and in a team-oriented environment



Nice-to-Have:

Forex Industry knowledge


Our offer:

Welcoming, young and multicultural team with approachable leadership
Continuous personal development, growth with the company and opportunity to learn from industry leaders
Competitive remuneration, regular salary reviews and performance-based incentive schemes
Vibrant company life: from team activities to global celebrations
New beautiful office in an easily accessible location with company-provided fruits, breakfasts and lunches
Free Gym membership and access to multiple sports and wellness facilities
Company-provided parking
Medical insurance, pension fund after the probation period



Journey to FP Markets:

Interview with People Function (45 min - 1 hour) to assess match to our culture and company
Interview with the future Hiring Manager  (45 min - 1 hour) to assess match to the job and the team



Join our team and be a part of a professional, rapidly-growing company operating in a multicultural environment!

Title: Data Analyst Intern
Description:
About REVER

Shoppers receive any purchase in 24h anywhere on the planet. Why can’t we also return & get refunded just as quickly? REVER is born to change how the world buys by giving superpowers to shoppers, because returning should be as easy as buying. We automate returns, refunds, and exchanges for ecommerce businesses across the globe. After being backed by Y-Combinator, market leading VCs and top founders from unicorns in Europe, we are now growing 10x yearly and expanding to more and more countries. To accelerate our growth even further, we are looking for game-changers to join our team.

We are like a sports team; we create an environment where everyone can give their max and we push each other to achieve our potential. We are data driven problem solvers, but most importantly fast learners. You’ll immerse yourself in a vibrant, youthful atmosphere with a lot of potential to grow internally.

You Will


Be part of the Product Automations team at REVER, which is in the center of Logistics, Operations, Finance, Data Analytics and Tech teams.
Be involved in the product and roadmap definition process to solve customer needs.
Interact with REVER clients and REVER internal Teams to understand their requests, needs & priorities
Make data-driven decisions to prioritize initiatives and be fast on their execution.
Implement solutions to our core product (both internal and external)
Build MVPs to validate new business opportunities


You Have


Analytical and data-driven mindset
Curious and open to challenge/ be challenged
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English
Ability to solve problems and make quick and effective decisions
Ready to engage yourself 100% in this adventure
You are a team player who inspires trust, are ready to take the initiative, and is distinguished by a customer-satisfaction-driven attitude;
You are interested in a start-up environment, you are proactive and ready to share your ideas to continue building the best product in the market


Why join us


Be at the forefront of scaling REVER.
Join a fast-growing, dynamic company with strong backing from top-tier investors.
Work alongside an international, passionate team in the heart of Barcelona.
Help shape the future of e-commerce and revolutionize the returns experience for customers around Europe.
Show more
HTML:
About REVER

Shoppers receive any purchase in 24h anywhere on the planet. Why can’t we also return & get refunded just as quickly? REVER is born to change how the world buys by giving superpowers to shoppers, because returning should be as easy as buying. We automate returns, refunds, and exchanges for ecommerce businesses across the globe. After being backed by Y-Combinator, market leading VCs and top founders from unicorns in Europe, we are now growing 10x yearly and expanding to more and more countries. To accelerate our growth even further, we are looking for game-changers to join our team.

We are like a sports team; we create an environment where everyone can give their max and we push each other to achieve our potential. We are data driven problem solvers, but most importantly fast learners. You’ll immerse yourself in a vibrant, youthful atmosphere with a lot of potential to grow internally.

You Will

  • Be part of the Product Automations team at REVER, which is in the center of Logistics, Operations, Finance, Data Analytics and Tech teams.
  • Be involved in the product and roadmap definition process to solve customer needs.
  • Interact with REVER clients and REVER internal Teams to understand their requests, needs & priorities
  • Make data-driven decisions to prioritize initiatives and be fast on their execution.
  • Implement solutions to our core product (both internal and external)
  • Build MVPs to validate new business opportunities

You Have

  • Analytical and data-driven mindset
  • Curious and open to challenge/ be challenged
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English
  • Ability to solve problems and make quick and effective decisions
  • Ready to engage yourself 100% in this adventure
  • You are a team player who inspires trust, are ready to take the initiative, and is distinguished by a customer-satisfaction-driven attitude;
  • You are interested in a start-up environment, you are proactive and ready to share your ideas to continue building the best product in the market

Why join us

  • Be at the forefront of scaling REVER.
  • Join a fast-growing, dynamic company with strong backing from top-tier investors.
  • Work alongside an international, passionate team in the heart of Barcelona.
  • Help shape the future of e-commerce and revolutionize the returns experience for customers around Europe.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
L’Open Banking è il nostro DNA!




Centrico ha le sue radici nelle rivoluzioni tecnologiche guidate dal gruppo Sella e dal 2019 è una realtà indipendente: creiamo innovazione per il mondo delle banche e della finanza con un sistema informativo aperto, veloce, modulabile e conveniente.




Il nostro obiettivo è diventare una data driven company!

Per vincere questa sfida, la persona che cerchiamo farà parte dell’area Data Management di Centrico in qualità di Data Analyst e si occuperà di analizzare i dati per fornire insights utili a supporto dei processi decisionali interni al Gruppo.




Responsabilità:

Analizzerai grandi quantità di dati per identificare trend, pattern e insights utili
Creerai report e dashboard per visualizzare i dati in modo chiaro e comprensibile
Collaborerai con team multidisciplinari (Business, IT, Compliance, Risk) per comprendere le esigenze di analisi dei dati e fornire soluzioni data-driven
Supporterai l’individuazione di regole e di livelli di controllo dell'accesso ai dati
Contribuirai al miglioramento continuo della piattaforma dati del Gruppo tramite l’implementazione di best practice e standard di settore




Requisiti:

Esperienza di almeno 4 anni nel medesimo ruolo o in ruolo affine
Laurea in discipline STEM
Conoscenza avanzata di strumenti di analisi dati (es. SQL, Python, R)
Buona conoscenza di strumenti di visualizzazione dati (es. Power BI, Tableau)
Ottime capacità relazionali sia verso interlocutori tecnici sia di business
Spiccate capacità analitiche e di problem solving




Nice to have:

Esperienza con tecnologie di big data (es. Hadoop, Spark)
Conoscenza di tecniche di machine learning e data mining
Esperienza con strumenti di ETL (es. Talend, Informatica)
Certificazioni professionali in ambito data analysis (es. Microsoft Certified: Data Analyst Associate)
Conoscenza di metodologie Agile e Scrum




Cosa offriamo:

Un ambiente positivo e in cui il tuo contributo venga apprezzato, la tua opinione è importante e vogliamo che tu la esprima
Piattaforma e-learning Microsoft: per non smettere mai di imparare e di certificarti
Attività di engagement (tornei di Beach Volley, Padel, Calcetto) e di volontariato aziendale
Contratto con CCNL del Credito
Cura della persona anche con la polizza sanitaria - per te e il tuo nucleo familiare - e polizza TCM
Supporto al benessere psicologico attraverso Stimulus, uno sportello esterno di ascolto a disposizione dei colleghi e dei loro famigliari
Uno sguardo al tuo futuro attraverso il contributo aziendale al fondo pensione
Policy di lavoro flessibile




Sede di lavoro: Milano o Torino o Biella con modalità ibrida.

Show more

Title: BI Analyst
Description:
Job Description

ABOUT THIS JOB

Flexibility. Fun. Freedom to grow. It’s all happening at NielsenIQ. This is a great opportunity for individuals aiming at building and developing a career in the world of Finance/BI. Our accurate, detail-oriented Financial Analysts/BI Specialists roll up their sleeves to provide analytical support for special projects, ad-hoc reviews and other communication to internal stakeholders. They also gain global experience in an engaging, multicultural work environment.

Responsibilities


Data Analysis:
Analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights that can drive business decisions
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather and interpret data requirements
Reporting and Dashboards:
Develop and maintain reports and dashboards using BI tools (eg. PowerBI)
Provide regular, accurate, and actionable insights to stakeholders
Data Visualization:
Create visually appealing and understandable data visualizations to communicate complex information effectively
Ensure that data visualizations align with business objectives and user requirements
Data Cleaning and Transformation:
Clean and preprocess raw data for analysis, ensuring data accuracy and consistency
Transform and structure data to meet the needs of various business units
Collaboration:
Work closely with business users and the Global Financial Planning and Analysis Team to understand their needs and requirements
Collaborate with the Development team to ensure data integrity and availability
Support/Coach junior members of the team in projects/developments
Continuous Learning:
Stay updated on industry trends, BI tools, and best practices
Participate in training and professional development opportunities to enhance skills


a Little Bit About You

You’re looking for a career with room to grow. You’re an ambitious and open-minded individual who is eager to learn. What is more, you have that passion and drive to develop your career within a truly international environment. You have a love relationship with BI tools and Excel spreadsheets. You’re not afraid to engage in discussion with IT-oriented colleagues. With your critical and analytical thinking abilities, you can create opportunities to better our business. You’re ready to break ground on what’s next.

Qualifications


Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Finance, Accounting, IT, Data Science or equivalent degree
Around 1.5 - 3 year of experience in financial and/or business intelligence positions
Able to work as part of a team in a multicultural environment
Knowledge of BI tools (e.g. Microsoft PowerBI)
Knowledge of SQL (e.g. PostgreSQL)
Advanced usage of MS Excel (VBA would be an asset)
Knowledge of OneStream / HFM / SAP would be a plus
Knowledge of ETL tools (e.g. Azure Data Factory, Alteryx) would be a plus
Fluent in English, both speaking and writing
Ability to interact with various stakeholders, incl. senior leaders
Ability to carry out tasks independently and support/coach junior members of the team


WE OFFER


Benefit package: Multisport card, private medical coverage Medicover, life insurance, Benefit platform allowing to purchase cinema and theatre tickets
Additional days off and recognition of special moments in your life
Stable working environment with employment contract
A possibility to create individual career paths, additional training
A possibility to engage in charity actions and participation in numerous social activities organised within the company
Modern office in a great location
Work in a mixed system: part of the week you work from home (home office), a part from the office. Therefore we provide all the necessary equipment to perform your duties from home
Mentoring - Mentee Program
Volunteer time off (global volunteer day)
Internal Recognition Program
Free LinkedIn Learning access that helps you discover and develop business, technology-related, and creative skills through over 20,000 courses available in 7 languages)
Free Employee Assistance Programs (EAP) - NIQ offers support to all associates and their families for their emotional well-being trough professional, timely and confidential counselling services on issues related to everyday concerns & problems, overcome emotional challenges, and maintain a healthy and balanced lifestyle


Additional Information

Our Benefits


Flexible working environment
Volunteer time off
LinkedIn Learning
Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)


About NIQ

NIQ is the world’s leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights—delivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms—NIQ delivers the Full View™. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world’s population.

For more information, visit NIQ.com

Want to keep up with our latest updates?

Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

NIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide. Learn more about how we are driving diversity and inclusion in everything we do by visiting the NIQ News Center: https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion

Title: Analista de datos
Description:
Antes de que te preguntes quiénes somos, te lo contamos...




Avalora es una empresa del sector tecnológico perteneciente a OHLA Group. Nuestras raíces comenzaron en Madrid, pero actualmente estamos en todo el país; incluso tenemos sedes en Chile y Perú.




No somos una big four, ni pretendemos serlo. Somos un grupo de compañeros pero también amigos que comparten una serie de beneficios como:




Seguro médico de salud (Sanitas). ⚕🏥
Clases de inglés para que puedas seguir perfeccionando el idioma, ¡Una divertida experiencia mientras aprendes! 🔛🌍🔝
Plan de retribución flexible, para que puedas destinar tu sueldo a lo que necesites: tickets restaurante, tickets guardería, seguro médico para tus familiares, plan de jubilación... 💱 🚄 🚌 👴 👵 👩‍🎓 👨‍🎓 👶 👧 👦 🍽 🏥
Plan de formación continua con gran variedad de cursos que puedan satisfacer tus necesidades (OpenWebinars, KnowBe4, UiPath...). Acceso 24x7, para que puedas formarte dónde y cuándo quieras. 👩‍🏫 👨‍🏫 🏫
Plan de Certificaciones: Somos partner de Microsoft, Uipath, Checkpoint ... entre otros por lo que podrás beneficiarte de nuestro plan. 🎓 👩‍🎓 👨‍🎓
VIP OHLA: Descuentos en multitud de empresas de ocio, tecnología, etc. ❗ ❗ ❗
22 días laborales de vacaciones por año trabajado. 🏕 🏖 🏜 😎




¡Únete a nuestro equipo!

Queremos contar con un perfil de Analista de Datos para trabajar en uno de nuestros clientes, en modalidad de teletrabajo 100% (dentro de España).







MODALIDAD: 100% remoto, pero pueden solicitar que acuda a oficina puntualmente.

CENTRO DE TRABAJO: San Fernando de Henares, Madrid




PERFIL

Análisis de datos y realización de Dashboard de KPIs, Principalmente en Power BI y valorable otras como Salesforce.
Elaboración de informes, análisis y preparación de datos para reporting, análisis y seguimiento de datos pipeline y comparativos.
Utilización y soporte de las herramientas corporativas para la gestión comercial y registro de la actividad comercial.




TITULACIÓN: ADE o Ingeniería

NIVEL DE INGLÉS: ALTO




Contrato indefinido con nosotros, dando servicio a un cliente.




Banda salarial: 25 - 30.000€ brutos anuales (14 pagas). Negociables en función de la experiencia.




Si tienes dudas escríbenos: seleccion@avalora.com




¡Estaremos encantados de hablar contigo!

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
📊 ¡Únete a nuestro equipo como Data Analyst y potencia la estrategia con datos! 🚀




¿Eres un apasionado del análisis de datos y la inteligencia de negocio? ¿Te encanta transformar números en estrategias y optimizar el rendimiento? Si buscas un entorno dinámico en el sector turístico donde cada análisis impacta directamente en la toma de decisiones… ¡Esta es tu oportunidad!




🔍 Tu misión como Data Analyst




Analizar indicadores clave (Ocupación, ADR, Ingresos, RevPAR) y proporcionar insights estratégicos.
Diseñar y mantener dashboards y reportes para los equipos de Ventas, Marketing, Operaciones y Revenue Management.
Identificar tendencias de mercado y comportamiento de clientes para mejorar la estrategia comercial.
Evaluar y optimizar el rendimiento de los canales de venta (Directo, TT.OO, OTAs).
Automatizar informes y procesos para agilizar la toma de decisiones.
Investigar fuentes externas como INE, Exceltur y asociaciones hoteleras para enriquecer el análisis.
Presentar hallazgos clave a la dirección mediante informes y visualizaciones impactantes.
Coordinación entre departamento de Paris HQ, con IT y con otros data’s analyst
NPS análisis a través de la plataforma de Medallia.




🎯 Lo que buscamos en ti




Formación en ADE, Turismo o similar.
Experiencia de al menos 2 años en análisis de datos, preferiblemente en turismo, hotelería o distribución digital.
Dominio de herramientas como Excel avanzado, Power BI, Tableau.
Capacidad de estructurar información, extraer insights y comunicar hallazgos de manera efectiva.
Pasión por la mejora continua, nuevas tecnologías y optimización de procesos.
Trabajo en equipo y excelentes habilidades comunicativas.
Inglés avanzado (otros idiomas son un plus).




✨ Valoramos positivamente:




Conocimientos en Google Analytics, Revenue Management y estrategias de pricing.
Familiaridad con PMS y plataformas de distribución hotelera.
Experiencia previa en sectores como aéreo, turismo o viajes.




🎁 Lo que ofrecemos




Formar parte de una empresa líder en el sector turístico.
Contrato fijo indefinido y estabilidad laboral.
1 día de teletrabajo semanal + jornada flexible.
Tickets restaurant y beneficios adicionales.
Descuentos exclusivos en alojamientos de la cadena.
Ambiente dinámico, innovador y lleno de oportunidades de crecimiento.










📢 ¿Listo para impulsar la estrategia con datos y marcar la diferencia? ¡Aplica ahora y conviértete en parte de nuestro equipo! 🚀

Show more

  • Coordinación entre departamento de Paris HQ, con IT y con otros data’s analyst
  • NPS análisis a través de la plataforma de Medallia.


🎯 Lo que buscamos en ti


  • Formación en ADE, Turismo o similar.
  • Experiencia de al menos 2 años en análisis de datos, preferiblemente en turismo, hotelería o distribución digital.
  • Dominio de herramientas como Excel avanzado, Power BI, Tableau.
  • Capacidad de estructurar información, extraer insights y comunicar hallazgos de manera efectiva.
  • Pasión por la mejora continua, nuevas tecnologías y optimización de procesos.
  • Trabajo en equipo y excelentes habilidades comunicativas.
  • Inglés avanzado (otros idiomas son un plus).


✨ Valoramos positivamente:


  • Conocimientos en Google Analytics, Revenue Management y estrategias de pricing.
  • Familiaridad con PMS y plataformas de distribución hotelera.
  • Experiencia previa en sectores como aéreo, turismo o viajes.


🎁 Lo que ofrecemos


  • Formar parte de una empresa líder en el sector turístico.
  • Contrato fijo indefinido y estabilidad laboral.
  • 1 día de teletrabajo semanal + jornada flexible.
  • Tickets restaurant y beneficios adicionales.
  • Descuentos exclusivos en alojamientos de la cadena.
  • Ambiente dinámico, innovador y lleno de oportunidades de crecimiento.




📢 ¿Listo para impulsar la estrategia con datos y marcar la diferencia? ¡Aplica ahora y conviértete en parte de nuestro equipo! 🚀

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Gupta Media was founded 20 years ago on the idea that advertising could create huge leverage in our client's business. Our early work was focused on the entertainment industry, specifically live events (Boston Calling, among others) and recorded music (Sony Music, Universal Music & Disney are all clients). We have dramatically grown our work with big brands (Amazon, Fender) and sports brands (LA Galaxy, Washington Commanders). We have a global client base with a growing local roster across B2B and B2C brands across campaign, content and branding assignments.




We are on the hunt for a talented Data Analyst to join our Strategy & Analytics team to assist with reporting, tracking, data analysis, advertising strategy, and visualization needs. In this role, you will work internally to assist paid media analysts with reporting requests as well as externally to provide clients with insights regarding their advertising campaigns.




If you are excited by the opportunity to improve reporting for our clients and our analysts, are able to communicate effectively to understand what tools will help solve a problem, and then work collaboratively to design a solution that’s scalable, accurate and easy-to-use, we want to talk to you.




Who You Are:

You have an absolute love for data. You have no problem tearing apart a problem, and living inside a spreadsheet/data set to find the answer to any question.
Because you love data, you have advanced knowledge of SQL, Excel, and Google Data Studio/Data Visualization and enjoy working with SQL on a day-to-day basis. Experience with Marketing APIs, Big Query or other Cloud Data Warehouse tools (AWS, Snowflake, Databricks, etc.), ETL Tools (Rivery, Looker, Supermetrics) and/or Python are all pluses.
You have a bachelor’s degree in a relevant field and have spent a minimum of 1 year working with marketing data and/or paid advertising campaigns, preferably in a fast-paced agency environment or team structure.




What You’ll Do:

Reporting: With your expertise in Advanced Excel, SQL, Google Data Studio/Visualization Tools, you’ll be maintaining customized dashboards in Google Sheets and Excel on a daily/weekly cadence, generating pivot tables and other visualizations that summarize thousands of lines of data. You should have experience in translating performance media metrics into coherent, digestible reports for client ad campaigns and be comfortable communicating via Google Slides or PowerPoint decks.
Strategy: You’ll be responsible for learning our clients’ businesses and aligning their media strategy with business goals as well as understanding advertising trends within a single project and across multiple projects to help guide media buying strategy. With a background in paid media and/or digital advertising, you understand concepts like LTV, ROAS, and Incremental Revenue and are able to be engaged in discussions with clients to gain trust and shareholder buy-in on media strategy and results.




At Gupta Media, we work hard every day to be better at all that we do — and that includes fostering a diverse and inclusive community that encourages and respects a broad range of backgrounds, experiences and ideas. Join us and help us find the next great idea.




Gupta Media is an office-first (with flexibility) organization and we are excited to have our team working together again

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Responsibilities

Kforce has an enterprise client seeking a Data Analyst 3 in North Reading, MA. Current Business Need:


Enhance data analytics capabilities for both OBDA and TASRS product lines
Implement automation solutions to reduce manual processing
Strengthen technical reporting infrastructure
Support product development and optimization


Business Impact


Streamline product-related data analysis
Improve reporting efficiency for product metrics
Enable data-driven product decisions
Automate manual processes to increase productivity
Support data preparation and cleansing for future system implementations
Bridge gaps between current systems and future state solutions
Develop interim solutions that align with long-term system strategy


Requirements


7+ years of progressive experience in business/reporting analytics roles
Mid to Senior level (5-10 years of relevant experience)
Business Analysis/Requirements Gathering (Expert level - 5+ years)
SQL/Reporting Development (Advanced level - 3+ years)
Automation Tools (VBA/Tableau) (Intermediate level - 2+ years)
Flexibility based on candidate qualifications and expertise
Experience with Oracle ERP systems and supply chain metrics
Strong proficiency in SQL, VBA, and Tableau for reporting automation
Proven track record of transforming business requirements into analytical solutions
Strong stakeholder management and communication abilities
Experience in developing and maintaining automated reporting systems
Strong proficiency in SQL database querying and management
Experience with Tableau or similar BI tools
VBA programming capabilities
Analytics and reporting expertise
Process automation experience
Experience with Oracle ERP systems
Understanding of supply chain planning tools
Knowledge of data integration between planning systems


Best vs. Average Candidates: Best candidates will demonstrate:


Strong business acumen and ability to translate requirements
Track record of developing automated reporting solutions
Experience managing multiple stakeholders effectively


Performance Indicators


Number of reports automated
Reduction in manual reporting effort
Accuracy and timeliness of business insights
Stakeholder satisfaction with reporting solutions


Leadership Principle


Bias for Action - Role requires quick understanding of business needs and implementing efficient reporting solutions while maintaining quality and accuracy


Preferred Qualifications


Experience in supply chain or operations analytics
Knowledge of supply chain KPIs and metrics
Prior experience with system transformation projects
Background in process automation initiatives


The pay range is the lowest to highest compensation we reasonably in good faith believe we would pay at posting for this role. We may ultimately pay more or less than this range. Employee pay is based on factors like relevant education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, seniority, location, performance, union contract and business needs. This range may be modified in the future.

We offer comprehensive benefits including medical/dental/vision insurance, HSA, FSA, 401(k), and life, disability & ADD insurance to eligible employees. Salaried personnel receive paid time off. Hourly employees are not eligible for paid time off unless required by law. Hourly employees on a Service Contract Act project are eligible for paid sick leave.

Note: Pay is not considered compensation until it is earned, vested and determinable. The amount and availability of any compensation remains in Kforce's sole discretion unless and until paid and may be modified in its discretion consistent with the law.

This job is not eligible for bonuses, incentives or commissions.

Kforce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

By clicking “Apply Today” you agree to receive calls, AI-generated calls, text messages or emails from Kforce and its affiliates, and service providers. Note that if you choose to communicate with Kforce via text messaging the frequency may vary, and message and data rates may apply. Carriers are not liable for delayed or undelivered messages. You will always have the right to cease communicating via text by using key words such as STOP.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Position: Data Analyst

Location: Hybrid in Quincy, MA

Duration: 4+ month contract with possibility of extensions




Our client is executing a large-scale data modernization across its agency. This includes creating a consolidated Enterprise Data Platform on modern cloud tools (including AWS & Snowflake,) and re-platforming existing business data applications from solutions such as SAS and legacy databases to the new platform. The data systems enable epidemiologists, public health researchers, state and local public health officials, and business leaders to analyze public health trends and drive policy decisions.




The Data Analyst will support this group in its efforts to implement a new central Data modernization program. The Data Analyst will provide input on best practices and potential efficiencies, work on multiple assignments concurrently to meet aggressive due dates. The Data Analyst will use a range of expert technical skills based on a keen knowledge of data and analytic concepts, and must be proficient with SQL, Python, R, Snowflake, SharePoint, Tableau and/or other Business Intelligence & Programming Tools. This resource needs to have hands on experience analyzing and interpreting complex data needs to develop solutions that improve decision making and operational efficiency. This resource will also be responsible for providing subject matter expertise in the development of requirements as agencies transition to the data modernization program.




In the initial stages of the engagement, the Analyst will be expected to work with data from multiple disparate sources to meet reporting goals. This will be data of varying completeness and quality from systems such as EHRs, enrollment platforms, and operations applications. As the Enterprise Data Platform matures and more data is integrated and improved, the Analyst will use their schools to generate data sets and analysis based on objects in Snowflake. The ideal candidate is comfortable in a maturing landscape and is able to use their data skills and business understanding to answer questions with imperfect systems.




JOB DUTIES:

Develop reports and data visualizations using Tableau Server
Provide ad-hoc reports and extract based on user requests
Provide gap analysis of current data extract process
Identify remediation of data pipeline process gaps and propose solutions
Validate results of all extracts and reports
Interact on a professional basis with internal and external staff in a personable manner
Develop reports as requested
Support on-going development of Key Performance Indicator Collection Tools and Reports
Communicate business requirements to developers and work with them to implement solutions for the business community where appropriate.
Communicate progress, or impediments to progress, to users and managers.
Organize and maintain workload and work independently with limited supervision
Participate in, and contribute to, team projects and meetings




SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS (Special Skill Set, Abilities & Knowledge):

Mange assigned requests from a variety of diverse business users
Understand business requirements, regulatory needs and their impact on business as well as well as the technology essential to support them
Maintain comprehensive code and documentation consistent with best practices and agency policy
Generate accurate deliverables consistently and under pressure
Evaluation requests, gather business requirements and creatively develop solutions, generating accurate deliverables consistently and under pressure
Improve and innovate processes and programs that meeting user needs
Produce standard and ad hoc reports using various tools and data sources
Conduct advanced data mining in a timely and accurate manner as required
Produce business and system documentation based on clients standards




EDUCATION and EXPERIENCE: (Education, Year' Experience & Certificates):

BS in Computer Science, related degree, or equivalent experience
Experience working with SQL, Python, R, Snowflake, SharePoint, Tableau and/or other Business Intelligence & Programming Tools required
3+ years' experience working as a programmer/developer, preferably in healthcare

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Warning: Fraudulent Job Adverts Beware of fraudulent activities claiming to represent Insurify. We are not associated with any entities soliciting personal information or payment. The safety of our job seekers is a top priority, and we actively work to prevent such incidents. Insurify will never request sensitive information or payment during the hiring process. Be cautious of text-only interviews, interviews conducted through Microsoft Teams, or suspicious offer letters.



Why us?

Insurify is one of the America's fastest-growing MIT FinTech startups and has been recognized as one of Inc. 5,000's fastest-growing private companies in America of 2023, 2022 and 2021, Forbes Fintech 50 List for 2023, 22, 21, Forbes Next Billion Dollar Startups of 2022 global and Top 100 InsurTech company. We're changing the way millions of people compare, buy and manage insurance with artificial intelligence, technology, and superior product design. Our company vision is to be recognized as the preeminent and most trusted digital agent for insurance comparison, purchase, and management. Our team is critical to achieving our vision and fostering the right culture is essential to our team's success.

Join us if you like


$1.3 Trillion market opportunity
MIT alumni founders
Female-led startup
$130M total funding
Strong leadership team with experience from many successful start-up's around the world


Our team is highly analytical, fast-moving, and focused on one thing: getting more people to compare insurance quotes using Insurify.

How you will make an impact:


Solve cross-functional, high velocity, high impact analytics problems. Scale the business using data.
A mix of business analytics, analytics engineering, and data science using SQL and python.
Ultimately, this role is about using data to make our company better across all areas of the business, so we want someone who is excited to tackle a wide range of structured and unstructured problems using data! Solutions do not come in neat boxes.


Sample projects:


Analyze a novel dataset to recommend areas for the business to improve
Operate and improve a core data product optimizing for multiple competing KPIs
Build new data pipelines to support tracking of a new business initiative
Innovate data modeling and data presentation to drive business understanding
Improve prediction accuracy of our customer acquisition machine learning bidding algorithms
Build reports and dashboards to help power the company's decision making
Do customer segmentation analysis to discover where to improve Insurify products


Key Skills


Bachelors in computer science, analytics, economics, or other STEM major required. Masters preferred.
Strong quantitative and programming skills with a product-driven sensibility.
Quick learning ability and a drive suitable for the startup hustle.
A friendly cooperative disposition and an eagerness to learn
Python (preferred) or R.
A positive team player with a solid work ethic who is ready to pivot between projects, learn from mistakes, always move forward, and help build the next big thing in insurance!
Expertise in and real-world experience with SQL.


Nice to have skills


Website tracking. HTML, Javascript, website tracking analytics, pixel and event tracking
Familiarity with production data systems, big data, spark, dbt, sql, spark
Any domain specific experience relevant to Marketing, SEO, Retention, Product
Knowledge of statistics.
Experience in data analysis in consumer / retail / e-commerce / SaaS.


Benefits


Competitive compensation
Generous stock options
Health, Dental Coverages
401K plan with match
Unlimited PTO
Generous company holiday calendar
Learning & Development Stipends
Paid Family Leave
Social impact volunteer time
Catered lunches in the office


We are proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer.

We are proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer.

  • Website tracking. HTML, Javascript, website tracking analytics, pixel and event tracking
  • Familiarity with production data systems, big data, spark, dbt, sql, spark
  • Any domain specific experience relevant to Marketing, SEO, Retention, Product
  • Knowledge of statistics.
  • Experience in data analysis in consumer / retail / e-commerce / SaaS.

Benefits

  • Competitive compensation
  • Generous stock options
  • Health, Dental Coverages
  • 401K plan with match
  • Unlimited PTO
  • Generous company holiday calendar
  • Learning & Development Stipends
  • Paid Family Leave
  • Social impact volunteer time
  • Catered lunches in the office

We are proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer.

We are proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
With more than 90,000 babies born since 1986, Boston IVF is one of the most experienced fertility centers in the world. We proudly offer the most innovative fertility treatments, groundbreaking reproductive technologies – and so much more. We diagnose the most difficult cases. We instill hope. We offer advice and a shoulder to lean on when our patients need it most. Our sole mission is to provide individuals and couples with the best chance for a successful pregnancy – and each day we cherish the bonds we form with our patients.




Boston IVF has a fulltime Data Analyst II position at our Waltham Facility. The Data Analyst II will report directly to the Director of Data Operations.




Responsibilities (including but not limited to):

As a Data Analyst II, you will:

Work across all company applications to maintain and enhance data integrity for both current and historical data
Manage and provide explanations for key metrics and figures displayed in existing Excel reports
Respond to report requests from various departments, ensuring timely and accurate delivery of data
Collaborate with the Director of Data Operations on database programming and scripting
Develop and implement new tools to automate workflows and improve efficiency across the company







Requirements (including but not limited to):

· 3–5 years of experience with Microsoft Excel (required, non-negotiable)

o Strong proficiency with PivotTables and PivotCharts (required, non-negotiable)

o Advanced knowledge of Excel formulas (e.g., VLOOKUP(), INDIRECT(), IFERROR(), etc.) (required, non-negotiable)

o Familiarity with macros/VBA (preferred but not required)

· Strong computer skills—must be tech-savvy with excellent keyboarding skills

· Proficiency in SQL/query languages and understanding of database relationships

· Experience creating detailed reports and explaining key metrics when needed

· Detail-oriented with strong analytical skills

· Bachelor’s degree required

· Strong communication and interpersonal skills—ability to work well in a team







Additional knowledge/skills preferred but not required

· Knowledge/experience in the medical field

· Experience with Filemaker

Show more

Title: Analyst, Data and Analysis
Description:
Analyst, Data and Analysis




The Data & Analysis team uses data-driven insights to fuel strategic growth for clients. We believe that data should never exist in a vacuum; instead, it should be put to work to bring the best ideas and stories to our clients




To help with this, we’re looking for an outstanding Analyst – someone who has a knack for understanding data and telling the story of why it matters. You’ll learn from the best in the business as you work with the team to bring actionable insights to our clients. Up for it? Read on.




As an Analyst, you’ll lay the groundwork and contribute to day-to-day reporting needs for client marketing efforts. You’ll work on brand campaigns, acquisition campaigns, site optimization, and/or online testing strategy.




Day-to-day, your role includes:

Keeping a pulse on day-to-day performance data, including display media, site, search, email, and/or social campaigns
Working in a variety of reporting systems and databases for the creation of recurring reports and dashboards
Identifying nuances in data to optimize our clients’ business
Supporting marketing initiatives across project and campaign lifecycles, including measurement plans, primary and secondary research, and performance reporting
Expanding industry knowledge and relevant skillsets through internal training




We’re looking for strong, impactful work experience, which typically includes:

1-3 years of work experience in a relevant industry
A four-year college degree
Passion for digital marketing, eagerness to learn in a constantly-changing space, and a natural curiosity
Familiarity with Excel and/or other data analysis tools such as SQL or Tableau a plus
Comfortable in a fast-paced and deadline-driven environment




Got what it takes? We’d love to hear from you!




2024-45606




Additional Information:

Compensation Range: $54,910 - $79,530 per year. This is the pay range the Company believes it will pay for this position at the time of this posting. Consistent with applicable law, compensation will be determined based on the skills, qualifications, and experience of the applicant along with the requirements of the position, and the Company reserves the right to modify this pay range at any time. Temporary roles may be eligible to participate in our freelancer/temporary employee medical plan through a third-party benefits administration system once certain criteria have been met. Temporary roles may also qualify for participation in our 401(k) plan after eligibility criteria have been met. For regular roles, the Company will offer medical coverage, dental, vision, disability, 401k, and paid time off.




Digitas is an equal opportunity employer. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.




About Digitas:

Digitas is the Networked Experience Agency, built on the vision that we create magnetic experiences that earn the right for brands to exist in human networks. Today, and tomorrow. We deliver Networked Experiences by leveraging comprehensive data, technology, creative, media and strategy capabilities. Digitas delivers ambitious outcomes via unique solutions that include Creative Experiences, Integrated Media, Addressable Relationships, Social Marketing and Total Commerce. Celebrated by AdAge as Data and Insights Agency of the Year, U.S Campaign’s Brand Experience Agency of the Year, Media Network of the Year and celebrated by Forrester and Gartner, Digitas serves the world’s leading brands through a global network comprised of more than 5,500 employees across over 65 offices in 43 countries.
